revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 09:50:14.000000000', 'message': 'Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

Additionally the transport_url directive has been moved to the
[DEFAULT] section.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop
deprecation warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

Change-Id: I4e6bf7fa75bc2b445e2a7047ef7ca14a36478e78
Closes-Bug: #1817672

commit_message:
Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

The above change requires a sync from charm-helpers.

Additionally the transport_url directive has been moved to the
[DEFAULT] section.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop
deprecation warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

Change-Id: I4e6bf7fa75bc2b445e2a7047ef7ca14a36478e78
Closes-Bug: #1817672

commit_message:
Database read write in bulk

1. Each processor event creates a few graph changes.
   Instead of persisting these seperatly, these are now persisted in bulk.

2. Scenario Evaluator read and write (active_actions table) are performed
   outside of the loop.

3. Evaluator and consistency generated actions are sent to the processor
   as lists, not as individual messages.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639330/
Change-Id: Iad3851d6969635730ffc0fb6a728a87e282d05c0

commit_message:
WIP-Telemetry Framework

DONT MERGED

This is just a PoC - not working yet

The openshift-sa.yml was used to create the inventory using tripleo-quickstart
Command to install the telemetry cloud.

openstack overcloud deploy --stack telemetry --templates /home/stack/tripleo-heat-templates/ -r /home/stack/tripleo-heat-templates/my_roles.yaml  -e /home/stack/tripleo-heat-templates/environments/telemetry.yaml -e /home/stack/tripleo-heat-templates/environments/networks-disable.yaml -e /home/stack/network-environment.yaml -e /home/stack/tripleo-heat-templates/params.yaml

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-22 21:51:11.000000000', 'message': "Add iptables -P FORWARD ACCEPT unit

On node reboot, kubelet and kube-proxy set
iptables -P FORWARD DROP which doesn't work with
flannel in the way we use it.
Add a systemd unit to set the rule to ACCEPT after
flannel,docker,kubelet,kube-proxy.

Change-Id: I7f6200a4966fda1cc701749bf1f37ddc492390c5
Co-Authored-By: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>
"}]
commit_message:
Add iptables -P FORWARD ACCEPT unit

On node reboot, kubelet and kube-proxy set
iptables -P FORWARD DROP which doesn't work with
flannel in the way we use it.
Add a systemd unit to set the rule to ACCEPT after
flannel,docker,kubelet,kube-proxy.

Change-Id: I7f6200a4966fda1cc701749bf1f37ddc492390c5
Co-Authored-By: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

commit_message:
Switch to using transport_url

Update templates to configure [DEFAULT]transport_url and remaining
SSL and HA options in [oslo_messaging_rabbitmq] using parts
from the openstack charm layer.

Change-Id: I428bec4461b038e11b62b284f6c096de3c05d72c
Closes-Bug: 1817672

size, used when reading/writing image files.

This can be extremely inefficient, especially when file shares are
used.

commit_message:
Filesystem driver: add chunk size config option

At the moment, the filesystem driver uses a hardcoded 64 KB chunk
size, used when reading/writing image files.

This can be extremely inefficient, especially when file shares are
used.

For this reason, this change will make it configurable.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1559c03308d36ecf9305c7a72ad658ecd1f2dc76
Closes-Bug: #1792869

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-09 00:44:01.000000000', 'message': "WIP - Switch container-build job on fedora-28

We are switching from Docker to Buildah and building containers on
CentOS7 isn't really good for these reasons:

- fuse-overlayfs isn't available in CentOS7 ans is extremely useful to
  build the images faster, otherwise we have to use vfs which is really
  too slow.
  See https://www.scrivano.org/2018/07/13/fuse-overlayfs-moved-to-github-com-containers/
- the version of Buildah + dependencies is more recent in Fedora.

We still continue to build centos7 containers, but we need to build them
from a different platform.

Note: We'll also have to patch RDO periodic jobs to run this playbook on
      Fedora.
      We also make sure Buildah is only used in Stein and beyond as we
      don't support it before.

blueprint podman-support
Depends-On: I7608136cb213bdca81348a0c3c751b488f48d712
Depends-On: Ieff41a5f84456530b4621218b01f3b546cd867bf

Change-Id: Ia43d96326fdcc9629696c972df1cf677cd69c87f

CentOS7 isn't really good for these reasons:

- fuse-overlayfs isn't available in CentOS7 ans is extremely useful to
  build the images faster, otherwise we have to use vfs which is really
  too slow.
  See https://www.scrivano.org/2018/07/13/fuse-overlayfs-moved-to-github-com-containers/
- the version of Buildah + dependencies is more recent in Fedora.

We still continue to build centos7 containers, but we need to build them
from a different platform.

Note: We'll also have to patch RDO periodic jobs to run this playbook on
      Fedora.
      We also make sure Buildah is only used in Stein and beyond as we
      don't support it before.
      Also, the centos-7 job is still needed in kolla CI. We won't
      remove it for now.

blueprint podman-support
Depends-On: I7608136cb213bdca81348a0c3c751b488f48d712
Depends-On: I5f375ab7f60572ffeced6a434c52e50dacf28dad
Change-Id: Ia43d96326fdcc9629696c972df1cf677cd69c87f

commit_message:
Create a new container build job with Buildah on centos7

This job will run in Stein and beyond, where we replace Docker by
Buildah to build images.

blueprint podman-support
Depends-On: I7608136cb213bdca81348a0c3c751b488f48d712
Change-Id: Ia43d96326fdcc9629696c972df1cf677cd69c87f

commit_message:
Simplify package list from openstack-base image

Remove the packages that are already pulled implicitly as a dependency.
A shorter package list should make it more manageable.

Change-Id: I690de645436065eee298a455221be8a6a0ae8083

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 06:28:26.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] move deployment tool related vars to vars dir

Since os_tempest is now used outside OSA. os_tempest has lots
of vars and the way deployment got configured varies. we can reuse
the vars folder to define the deployment specific common vars so
that enduser has expose few vars and it will make their life
easier.

Added tempest_deployment_target var to specify the same.

Change-Id: Iaeecaa2de35925cf0ac4b14fedfde47baab16b01
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] move deployment tool related vars to vars dir

Since os_tempest is now used outside OSA. os_tempest has lots
of vars and the way deployment got configured varies. we can reuse
the vars folder to define the deployment specific common vars so
that enduser has expose few vars and it will make their life
easier.

Added tempest_deployment_target var to specify the same.

Change-Id: Iaeecaa2de35925cf0ac4b14fedfde47baab16b01

commit_message:
Remove redundant second cast to int

In commit d51dcaa87c416ea0a69074d2ad4de26d72bbefa1 the 'used'
value was explicitly made an int, twice. It only needs to be
done once.

Change-Id: Ib9dc6ba004ffacda9044f42ace745d147d294ca0

commit_message:
remove publish-loci-requirements post-job

Needed as it's breaking requirements post jobs.  We cannot use
another repos secrets without being marked as a trusted repo.

Change-Id: I8806ae39db50534993d6113a623adbe22c2d15d9
Story: 2005108

commit_message:
Add tests for project users interacting with protocols

This commit introduces some tests that show how project users
are expected to behave with the federated protocol API.
A subsequent patch will clean up the now obsolete policies in the
policy.v3cloudsample.json file.

Change-Id: Ib5f2ea776a57d36f4fe558169b0a14d0b90ec11c
Related-Bug: 1806762

commit_message:
Add tests for domain users interacting with protocols

This commit introduces some tests that show how domain users are
expected to behave with the federated protocols API. A
subsequent patch will do the same for project users.

Change-Id: Ic389fc76d2879a862061cee70d25aaa570f2f41b
Related-Bug: 1806762

commit_message:
Implement system admin role in protocol API

This commit introduces the system admin role to the protocol API,
making it consistent with other system-admin policy definitions.

Subsequent patches will build on this work to expose more
functionality to domain and project users:

 - domain user test coverage
 - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I9384e0fdd95545f1afef65a5e97e8513b709f150
Closes-Bug: 1804523
Related-Bug: 1806762

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-10-30 21:02:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Overall structure looks good!

I think this schema is a bit unnatural and maybe too tightly coupled to a particular usage. I think it would be nice to use a more natural and general translation such as below. In general, it's good for a data source driver to make most of the information available unless it's too obscure or difficult or way too many columns. Of course, I'm not particularly familiar with tacker so pls take that into account in using my suggestion =)

vnfs: id, name, status, description, instance_id, vim_id, created_at, updated_at, error_reason

vnfs.mgmt_url: id, key, url

vnfds: id, name, description, template_source, tenant_id, created_at, updated_at"}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-10-31 10:00:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Thanks Akhil. Some comments inline.
And also agree with Eric, schema should be generic enough.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-11-29 09:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-11-29 10:39:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(6 comments)

Thanks Eric and Anusha for detailed review. I have tried to make it generic according to reviews. Please review.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-12-03 05:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-12-03 07:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-12-03 22:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

LGTM!

Either here or in a separate patch, we could also add a release note in the feature section.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-12-04 10:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks Akhil for the patch. Looks good.
Could you add tempest service to devstack plugin. and also +1 for release notes'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-12-10 08:51:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-12-10 08:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)

Thanks Eric and Anusha for review. Added releasenote and updated devstack plugin. Also replied to comment given by Anusha(Please correct me if I am wrong)'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-12-10 19:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

lgtm!'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-01-30 00:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-02-27 02:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Published edit on patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2019-02-27 22:06:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

LGTM.

If we can't get the devstack setup at gate working, we could separate that out into another patch and merge the driver first."}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-02-28 01:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-02-28 01:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

Yes Eric, agree with you. Removed those changes'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2019-02-28 02:19:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2

Great! Considering the imminent feature freeze, let's merge this as long as we've tested manually and add the tempest tests by/during RC.

Akhil please feel free to workflow +1 when you think it's ready."}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-02-28 03:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Add tacker datasource driver

This commit adds Tacker driver and unit tests. Which creates
corresponding datasource on service startup and allows congress
to maintain Tacker's VNF and VNFD data via populating data to tables
vnfs and vnfds respectively. Based on which rules
can be created and actions can be executed on tacker service.

Change-Id: I281e8ff508dd066514694419c5aae6a991ab307c
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-tacker-datasource-driver

avoid referencing the undefined temp file path.

commit_message:
Skip ssh_known_hosts tasks in check mode

The tempfile task is skipped in check mode so we need to skip all tasks to
avoid referencing the undefined temp file path.

Change-Id: I87a4b40387cabed86e04efa64ddc19f117693589
Closes-Bug: 1817765
(cherry picked from commit 6f538dc820f0a0117c33b933fc21d0d8406d5638)

commit_message:
Add protocol tests for system member role

From keystone's perspective, the ``member`` and ``reader`` roles are
effectively the same, isolating writable protocol operations
to the ``admin`` role.

This commit adds explicit testing to make sure the ``member`` role is
allowed to perform readable and not writable protocol
operations. Subsequent patches will incorporate.

 - system admin functionality
 - domain users test coverage
 - project users test coverage

 Related-Bug: 1804523
 Related-Bug: 1806762

Change-Id: I55751a045cdb315c7534ee84a5c1fe5fb18aa65f

[{'created': '2019-02-14 22:59:16.000000000', 'message': 'Generic webhook processer for JsonIngester

Each table accepting webhook is configured with a jsonpath expression
to grab the unique ID from the webhook payload.

Each time a webhook comes in, the new data is written to the Postgres
database in jsonb format, replacing any previous webhook data with
the same ID.

The _key column type is changed from bigint to text in order to
accommodate custom keys in generic webhook processing.

PollingJsonIngester is renamed to JsonIngester because it is no
longer specialized to polling.

config format is changed slightly to clearly define which tables
are configured for polling and/or webhook.

A table that is updated through both poll and webhook is not
supported by this patch, but may be supported in the future.

commit_message:
Generic webhook processer for JsonIngester

Each table accepting webhook is configured with a jsonpath expression
to grab the unique ID from the webhook payload.

Each time a webhook comes in, the new data is written to the Postgres
database in jsonb format, replacing any previous webhook data with
the same ID.

The _key column type is changed from bigint to text in order to
accommodate custom keys in generic webhook processing.

PollingJsonIngester is renamed to JsonIngester because it is no
longer specialized to polling.

config format is changed slightly to clearly define which tables
are configured for polling and/or webhook.

A table that is updated through both poll and webhook is not
supported by this patch, but may be supported in the future.

Change-Id: I23c3d5c2c63fd8471868c2b37fd154eb2d1f9783
partially-implements: bp json-data-model

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-26 01:13:39.000000000', 'message': 'PollingJsonIngester differential update to DB

Instead of rewriting the entire DB table on each poll, update the
table by adding new records and deleting records no longer
needed.
Because the change is usually much smaller than the entire table,
ingest performance should be much improved, allowing the ingested
state to be more current.
A _key column is added to each table of json records to facilitate
performant deletion of specific records without linear scan.

Also includes small improvements and variable renames.

Change-Id: I3ea4f0325c34d9eef38d7ee64f0bca60e9241620

commit_message:
PollingJsonIngester differential update to DB

Instead of rewriting the entire DB table on each poll, update the
table by adding new records and deleting records no longer
needed.
Because the change is usually much smaller than the entire table,
ingest performance should be much improved, allowing the ingested
state to be more current.
A _key column is added to each table of json records to facilitate
performant deletion of specific records without linear scan.

Also includes small improvements and variable renames.

Change-Id: I3ea4f0325c34d9eef38d7ee64f0bca60e9241620
partially-implements: bp json-data-model

commit_message:
Remove role policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

By incorporating system-scope and default roles, we've effectively
made these policies obsolete. We can simplify what we maintain and
provide a more consistent, unified view of default role behavior by
removing them.

Note that these changes are slightly different from the
policy.v3cloudsample.json role policies, hence the removed tests. In
policy.v3cloudsample.json, domain users were allowed to get and list
global roles. So were project users. This behavior is changing because
global roles are considered global resources of the deployment, and
they should be managed by system users. Domain users should be able to
add and remove domain specific roles, which will come in a subsequent
series of patches. This approach is being taken because it is a safer
default for a system level resource (global roles) and still allows
the same functionality for domain users through domain-specific roles.

Change-Id: Iddaa59024a1dcefd4d791b95413602865888c1ff
Closes-Bug: 1806713

commit_message:
Add tests for project users interacting with roles

This commit introduces test coverage that explicitly shows how
project users are expected to behave global role resources. A
subsequent patch will clean up the now obsolete policies in the
policy.v3cloudsample.json policy file.

Change-Id: Id0dc3022ab294e73aeaa87e130bea4809f8c982b
Partial-Bug: 1806713

considered global resources of the deployment, and they should be
managed by system users. Domain users should be able to add and remove
domain specific roles, which will come in a subsequent series of
patches. This approach is being taken because it is a safer default
for a system level resource (roles) and still allows the same
functionality for domain users through domain-specific roles.

functionality for domain users through domain-specific roles.

Change-Id: Ia1a7adf4431042ecea1b41e3c589c55112183ab5
Partial-Bug: 1806713

commit_message:
Add tests for domain users interacting with roles

This commit adds explicit tests that show how domain users
are expected to behave with global roles. A subsequent patch
will do the same for project users.

Note that these changes are slightly different from the
policy.v3cloudsample.json role policies. In policy.v3cloudsample.json,
domain users were allowed to get and list global roles. So were
project users. This behavior is changing because global roles are
considered global resources of the deployment, and they should be
managed by system users. Domain users should be able to add and remove
domain specific roles, which will come in a subsequent series of
patches. This approach is being taken because it is a safer default
for a system level resource (roles) and still allows the same
functionality for domain users through domain-specific roles.

Change-Id: Ia1a7adf4431042ecea1b41e3c589c55112183ab5
Partial-Bug: 1806713
Partial-Bug: 1805400

commit_message:
Fix PEP8 CI breakage

The infer_name_module() method was removed from astroid in the version
2.2.0 [0] (astroid is blacklisted in openstack/requirements, so we do
not constraint it). That method was then moved to pylint which we do
constainst so, this patch is updating the version of pylint (to the one
that includes that method) and fixing few pep8 errors as well.

[0]
https://github.com/PyCQA/astroid/commit/51891dc8179a709bf18c7f2869ca32f2ec8a2e92

Change-Id: I871b442b62b83d28e7d0cacd9bd4dad388e50e88
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Consume networking-sfc stein b1

As of now, due to bug 1817555, networking-sfc code cannot be pulled
from the master branch even if we specify it in 'required-projects'.
As a workaround, this commit specifies networking-sfc stein b1
in requirements.txt (and lower-constraints.txt accordingly) like
what was done in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639363/

This is likely a better short term solution than moving those
requirements into their own file as we did in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638099/

Change-Id: I286b49875416b2e44162b39cd156a954db688ebd

commit_message:
stop using common db mixin methods

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather
than those of the mixin.

Change-Id: Id4c5403f45c8b8f63b74c358200a4c82e0b88520

commit_message:
Fix ansible-playbook-3 symlink

The symlink needs to be created with sudo because if validations are
enabled, the call to run ansible-playbook-3 is before the "sudo tripleo deploy
command".

This patch moves the symlink into a function, that will be called before
the preflight if enabled and during the tripleo deploy/upgrade command,
which should cover standalone deployment and upgrade.

Change-Id: I1ce9b3df6c937cd796728d4fc5921fcf1023e5db

commit_message:
Update protocol policies for system reader

The protocol policies were not taking the default roles work
we did last release into account. This commit changes the default
policies to rely on the ``reader`` role for get and list protocols.
Subsequent patches will incorporate:

 - system member test coverage
 - system admin functionality
 - domain users test coverage
 - project users test coverage

Change-Id: I4e8887cffb882ab7a52ff6249f98fd026fc72dce
Related-Bug: 1804523
Related-Bug: 1806762

commit_message:
Populate bindep.txt

Adds missing dependencies for testing tripleo-ci repository.

This is needed due to: wheel->cryptography->openssl-devel

Likely not observed so far because we had an image with it already
installed but on clean systems is likely to need it.

Change-Id: I15e372b061ee6d7518613872fa91f198de9b74a1

commit_message:
rehome sqlalchemytypes

This patch rehome neutron.db.sqlalchemytypes into neutron_lib.db along
with corresponding unit tests.
In addition get_random_cidr() is rehomed from neutron's test tools into
neutron-lib.tests._tools and this module is made public.

This work is part of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621000/

Change-Id: Idffdaca49faa1ff972e353c0ecacba2c2cc51a02

should be covered in the neutron gate rally job. As I set out to write

commit_message:
Add FloatingIP scenarios

As discussed on the neutron-performance meeting [1] floating IP operations
should be covered in the neutron gate rally job. As I set out to write
the missing tests I discovered that some of them were already written
by rally folks. For example see [2]. Keep in mind the test code has been
relocated since to the rally-openstack repository. For example see [3].
They were later added to neutron's rally job definition [4].

Here we add one more scenario to exercise the floating IP operations
left uncovered by the above changes: associate and dissociate.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_performance/2018/neutron_performance.2018-10-22-16.02.log.html#l-143
[2] https://review.openstack.org/225223
[3] https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/4e4bfc5/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/network.py
[4] https://review.openstack.org/620952

Change-Id: I32f3bad82fa0ca822e80d51220c120568a709332
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/624038

commit_message:
add additional check and gate jobs for os-vif

- This change adds 2 new jobs to the check and gate pipeline
  and defines a base os-vif tempest job for common settings.
- This change adds an os-vif-ovs-iptables job to test the
  ovs plugin  when using iptables for neutron security groups.
  This combination uses the hybrid plug mechanism which is not
  used in the standard os-vif-ovs job.
- This change adds an os-vif-linuxbridge job to test the linux
  bridge plugin.

Change-Id: I0da1f744d252e0ffb2623061230f13d45f951fc3

Update json module to jsonutils

this PS to update the remained json moudule to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

subject: Add neutron-tempest-plugin to global requirements
messages: [{'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2019-02-21 01:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-02-21 18:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-02-21 19:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-02-26 00:41:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-02-28 00:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as Ie3c432c68177a75b8bebb14135debef76d7ae497'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-21 01:41:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add neutron-tempest-plugin to global requirements

Some projects which have neutron tempest tests depend on
neutron-tempest-plugin. So, this commit adds it to the global
requirements to resolve the dependency properly.

* Is the library actively maintained?
  Yes.
* Is the library good code?
  Yes.
* Is the library python 3 compatible?
  Yes.
* Is the library license compatible?
  Yes. It uses Apache 2.0, of course.
* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
  It is in Ubuntu disco already. And it is also on PyPI.
* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in global-requirements.txt?
  No.
* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup?
  Yes. Some projects such as neutron-dynamic-routing, networking-spp and
  networking-l2gw-tempest-plugin want to add a test-requirements on
  them.
* If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
  does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
  No.
* Do I need to update anything else?
  No.

Change-Id: I417d3e7b89ac2c58cc3f7e221162a54897645be8
'}]
commit_message:
Add neutron-tempest-plugin to global requirements

Some projects which have neutron tempest tests depend on
neutron-tempest-plugin. So, this commit adds it to the global
requirements to resolve the dependency properly.

* Is the library actively maintained?
  Yes.
* Is the library good code?
  Yes.
* Is the library python 3 compatible?
  Yes.
* Is the library license compatible?
  Yes. It uses Apache 2.0, of course.
* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
  It is in Ubuntu disco already. And it is also on PyPI.
* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in global-requirements.txt?
  No.
* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup?
  Yes. Some projects such as neutron-dynamic-routing, networking-spp and
  networking-l2gw-tempest-plugin want to add a test-requirements on
  them.
* If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
  does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
  No.
* Do I need to update anything else?
  No.

Change-Id: I417d3e7b89ac2c58cc3f7e221162a54897645be8

commit_message:
[k8s-fedora-atomic] Security group definition for worker nodes

Defines more strict security group rules for kubernetes worker nodes. The
ports that are open by default: default port range(30000-32767) for
external service ports; kubelet healthcheck port; Calico BGP network ports;
flannel overlay network ports. The cluster admin should manually config the
security group on the nodes where Traefik is allowed.

Story: #2005082
Task: #29661
Change-Id: Idbc67cb95133d3a4029105e6d4dc92519c816288

[{'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-15 23:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-18 14:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2019-02-18 17:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-18 17:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Added Ken and Andy from oslo.messaging to see if I am approaching this the right way, or if there is a better method.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-02-18 17:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-02-19 13:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-19 21:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-02-20 16:36:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The AMQPDestinationNotFound is intended to be an internal exception that is triggered only when sending a reply to a queue that no longer exists.  It is meant to prevent continually retrying to send an rpc reply to a client that no longer exists.

That functionality is wrapped in a try except block here:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.messaging/tree/oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py#n128

Which should prevent the AMQPDestinationNotFound from being propagated further up.

There is _one_ other codepath that does invoke the send reply path without catching AMQPDestinationNotFound: 

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.messaging/tree/oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py#n170

This heartbeat call is only invoked when the call_monitor_timeout parameter is used by the RPCClient (it is disabled by default):
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.messaging/tree/oslo_messaging/rpc/client.py#n328

So if you're not using call monitoring that particular case won't apply.

TL;DR - catching MessageDeliveryFailure should be enough...

.. unless you're actually getting an AMQPDestinationNotFound, which would be a bug in oslo.messaging that I'd need to fix."}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-20 22:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the explanation Ken, that really helps me understand what is going on under the hood in oslo.messaging.  Changing this to use MessageDeliveryFailure.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-20 22:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2019-02-20 22:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Good, one minor cleanup needed.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-02-21 14:17:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Just FYI I cleaned up that one case in the call monitor code just to be complete:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1816816

Not that it affects your patch.  It's great that you asked about this since I'd never find the problem otherwise! :)"}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-21 14:25:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-21 14:25:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-21 20:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2019-02-21 21:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-02-22 13:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-02-27 21:47:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-02-27 21:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Catch only MessageDeliveryFailure exceptions

There was a todo left to only catch MessageDeliveryFailure exceptions
once they were being propagated properly; the bug related to that [1]
has been closed and the fix is merged [2].  So we can catch only the
correct error and eliminate the TODO.

TrivialFix

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1705351
[2] https://review.openstack.org/486706

Change-Id: I1201ee150709b84e6f4b2fa4b108da9ea28983a3

[{'created': '2019-02-26 18:01:00.000000000', 'message': "container-image-prepare: redirect all output to logfile

If container_image_prepare_debug, we also want to redirect all the
output into the same logfile used to write image operations.

Indeed, some command output isn't shown in the logfile, even with
--debug, but sent to sdterr.

To make it easier for operators on where to find logs, let's just use
the logfile in place and export everything in there, only when debug is
activated.

Change-Id: I66e846bda2bef0d27a2a26a4083249c583982e0c
"}]
commit_message:
container-image-prepare: redirect all output to logfile

If container_image_prepare_debug, we also want to redirect all the
output into the same logfile used to write image operations.

Indeed, some command output isn't shown in the logfile, even with
--debug, but sent to sdterr.

To make it easier for operators on where to find logs, let's just use
the logfile in place and export everything in there, only when debug is
activated.

Change-Id: I66e846bda2bef0d27a2a26a4083249c583982e0c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 16:56:52.000000000', 'message': "Remove ml2's accidental dependency on l3

The accidental dependency was never in effect since the neutron side of
the relevant changes was not merged yet.

I think I made a mistake in https://review.openstack.org/631515.
We added the 'router' extension as a dependency of the
'floatingip-autodelete-internal' extension. Which looks a perfectly
reasonable thing to do at first sight. However since the 'external-net'
extension was de-extensionalized and made part of the ml2 plugin, the
'floatingip-autodelete-internal' extension also had to be implemented by
the ml2 plugin. This complicated setup practically made the l3 plugin
a dependency of the ml2 plugin. (That's why unit tests started failing
in patch set #3 of the neutron change.) Which of course is non-sense.

So this change removes the dependency. The neutron side of this
change still degrades gracefully even without the explicit dependency
between the extensions, so I don't think we're losing anything by not
having that dependency.

Change-Id: I8825eaf4f46ea2639131e34f9b833af1de6ab1b4
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/624751
Partial-Bug: #1806032
Related-Change: https://review.openstack.org/631515
"}, {'created': '2019-02-20 06:33:32.000000000', 'message': "Remove ml2's accidental dependency on l3

commit_message:
Remove ml2's accidental dependency on l3

The accidental dependency was never in effect since the neutron side of
the relevant changes was not merged yet.

I think I made a mistake in https://review.openstack.org/631515.
We added the 'router' extension as a dependency of the
'floatingip-autodelete-internal' extension. Which looks a perfectly
reasonable thing to do at first sight. However since the 'external-net'
extension was de-extensionalized and made part of the ml2 plugin, the
'floatingip-autodelete-internal' extension also had to be implemented by
the ml2 plugin. This complicated setup practically made the l3 plugin
a dependency of the ml2 plugin. (That's why unit tests started failing
in patch set #3 of the neutron change.) Which of course is non-sense.

So this change removes the dependency. The neutron side of this
change still degrades gracefully even without the explicit dependency
between the extensions, so I don't think we're losing anything by not
having that dependency.

Change-Id: I8825eaf4f46ea2639131e34f9b833af1de6ab1b4
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/624751
Partial-Bug: #1806032
Related-Change: https://review.openstack.org/631515

commit_message:
Introduce subnet pool prefix operations extension

This introduces a new extension that provides API's that enable
operations against the prefix list of a subnet pool to be more
explicit. In its current form, the subnetpool extension does not
clearly define how operations on the prefix list of a subnet pool
are to be performed and leaves unnecessary ambiguity to be handled
by implementers of the extension. This extension makes prefix
management for subnet pools explicit operations, while making support
for this discoverable for clients.

Change-Id: Ia84d767f582f28a2fc77799a58f6729a7fd42f34
Related-Bug: #1792901

requirement to do the ping test is actually to verify connectivity

commit_message:
Do ping test from tempest host and disable it by default

Currently the ping test runs from the tempest_service_setup_host,
which may not have the correct package installed to execute it.
The ping package is installed on to the tempest host, and the
requirement to do the ping test is actually to verify connectivity
from the tempest host before running tempest itself.

This patch changes the ping test to run from the tempest host,
and because the test is primarily for gate testing, it is disabled
by default.

Change-Id: I3d1f9e17ef45b4427e8d3088bbcfa0c0df126c4a

commit_message:
Make the use of the CastAsCall fixture configurable

In a subsequent patch the CastAsCall fixture will need to *not* be
used in new functional tests in order to avoid NoValidHost
exceptions from the scheduler select_destination() cast/call ending up
in the API as 500 errors. This patch adds a USE_CAST_AS_CALL flag,
defaulted to True, that allows test classes to disable the CastAsCall
fixture if they don't want it.

Change-Id: I13deb7cb02414ffbf8758911a5b69baa69cd1078

commit_message:
Add "master" parameter to ip.set() API function

This parameter is present in the IpCommand abstract class and both
Windows and Linux implementations.

This change modifies the pyroute2 driver to lookup the
interface index of the bridge when setting the master paramater
on a port.

This change add a functional test to use the master paramater
to add an interface to a bridge and validate it works correctly.

Change-Id: I54ded32281c6a5b67b6ccb9f1bdb6e3fb6731049
Closes-Bug: #1817919

run-netapp-ci'}, {'account_id': 24005, 'date': '2018-03-15 19:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Bug 1482382 was already marked as fixed and backported to stable
 > branches.  Should this really be re-fixing the same bug?

Bug 1482382 needs a patches in both oslo.concurrency and cinder. oslo.concurrency changes (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537823/) marked bug as fixed but we need to fix it in cinder as well.'}, {'account_id': 24005, 'date': '2018-03-15 20:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I do not think this is ok because the output is going to always not
 > be sanitized.  I think a different solution needs to be found.  I
 > thought we could use a separate function for masking passwords
 > after the output is returned.  Could we do something with that
 > instead?

Yes, it always skip masking of passwords in command output if sanitize_stdout=False, but it always sanitize the output in case of any errors in command execution because there might be chance that due to poor implementation of command run program it may reveals sensitive information like password to stdout.'}, {'account_id': 24005, 'date': '2018-03-23 19:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18883, 'date': '2018-03-23 19:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Skip masking of command output over ssh

When a volume has "password" string in its name, volume
details retrieved through ssh command execution is being masked
away by processutils.ssh_execute() which is causing unexpected errors
during parsing of command output. Since processutils.ssh_execute()
handles masking of sensitive information in stdout, stderr when
command execution fails, skip it in case of command runs successfully.

Change-Id: Ie683af1ec5976e71bd770f92b428458d12898d1f
Closes-bug: #1482382

commit_message:
VNX Driver: delete_hba() instead of remove_hba()

The storops drivers doesn't have a remove_hba() function,
it's called delete_hba(). The confusion comes from the fact
that storops uses -removeHBA argument when calling
naviseccli.

Change-Id: I3f72481442436ddf78c10ab53c161663b05a330a
Closes-bug: #1813525
(cherry picked from commit 6145f8583ad1b1b5c631534b1dc05d8bf89c330e)
(cherry picked from commit acca9dbc7cc990ea8f65b5d96233fa8b8ad9cfe4)

[{'created': '2019-02-23 11:44:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for auth version change in Brcd HTTP

On FOS 8.1.0b and greater firmwares, the authentication
for HTTP sessions has changed.  Add check to get
the auth version, then authenticate with identifier
rather than randomno when authversion is not 1.

Also, the formatting of nsinfo.htm has changed,
so now using the formatted nsinfo.html page
to gather nport wwns from the name server.

Change-Id: Ia2773f930513a5c8914e40805291d015a2ecb130
Closes-Bug: #1810327
(cherry picked from commit 28a696ea625e4113706e030b773fcf39cb1c49a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for auth version change in Brcd HTTP

On FOS 8.1.0b and greater firmwares, the authentication
for HTTP sessions has changed.  Add check to get
the auth version, then authenticate with identifier
rather than randomno when authversion is not 1.

Also, the formatting of nsinfo.htm has changed,
so now using the formatted nsinfo.html page
to gather nport wwns from the name server.

Change-Id: Ia2773f930513a5c8914e40805291d015a2ecb130
Closes-Bug: #1810327
(cherry picked from commit 28a696ea625e4113706e030b773fcf39cb1c49a1)

(cherry picked from commit 175aaa879d8b940d800e1b96e8871bd350798038)

This patch will always add a '/' to the endpoint url end.

Closes-bug: #1816793
Change-Id: I6b0f47fc5b11c44a767e0ebfe2929e560c5f5432
(cherry picked from commit 175aaa879d8b940d800e1b96e8871bd350798038)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix version return incorrect when endpoint url end without /

when request to cinder endpoint url end without /
$ curl http://127.0.0.1/volume
the version href return incorrect, like below:
"href": "http://127.0.0.1/v2/"
"href": "http://127.0.0.1/v3/"
This patch will always add a '/' to the endpoint url end.

Closes-bug: #1816793
Change-Id: I6b0f47fc5b11c44a767e0ebfe2929e560c5f5432
(cherry picked from commit 175aaa879d8b940d800e1b96e8871bd350798038)

[{'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-09-04 15:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-09-04 15:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-09-05 08:52:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-09-05 13:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

That has been in for two years, I think the proper solution is to silently accept and ignore the option, not remove it completely.'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-09-05 16:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> That has been in for two years, I think the proper solution is to
 > silently accept and ignore the option, not remove it completely.

And reword the help section to say "actually does nothing"? I can do that, it would work for users trying to expand a subnet (as the set command automatically removes the included ones)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-09-05 18:11:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

> That has been in for two years, I think the proper solution is to silently accept and ignore the option, not remove it completely.

I don't understand.  The option isn't supported and currently generates an error, so noone is relying on it working.  Making it silent will lead to more confusion since users will think it worked, leading to a "why didn't subnetpool unset do anything?" bug.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-09-18 15:05:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We now have our second neutron bug regarding this, https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1792901

Can we get this merged since it's an invalid option?"}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-09-26 14:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I think this is just bringing the CLI in line with the API'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-09-26 16:53:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Just because a bug has existed for two years shouldn't be a reason not to fix it."}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-09-27 02:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I took the time to test this with the following sequence of commands:

$ openstack subnet pool create --pool-prefix 10.5.0.0/24 --pool-prefix 10.6.0.0/24 my-subnet-pool

| Field             | Value                                |
+-------------------+--------------------------------------+
| address_scope_id  | None                                 |
| created_at        | 2018-09-27T02:40:27Z                 |
| default_prefixlen | 8                                    |
| default_quota     | None                                 |
| description       |                                      |
| id                | 25ad4d7d-0856-4e29-af19-2af89430ea0a |
| ip_version        | 4                                    |
| is_default        | False                                |
| max_prefixlen     | 32                                   |
| min_prefixlen     | 8                                    |

$ openstack subnet pool unset --pool-prefix 10.6.0.0/24 25ad4d7d-0856-4e29-af19-2af89430ea0a
BadRequestException: 400: Client Error for url: http://192.168.33.12:9696/v2.0/subnetpools/25ad4d7d-0856-4e29-af19-2af89430ea0a, {"NeutronError": {"message": "Illegal update to prefixes: Existing prefixes must be a subset of the new prefixes.", "type": "IllegalSubnetPoolPrefixUpdate", "detail": ""}}

So, yes, as Brian indicates, nobody is depending in this functionality in the client. It should be removed'}, {'account_id': 27602, 'date': '2018-09-27 03:02:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Partially Revert "Add command to unset information from Subnet-pools"

We do not support removing a prefix from a subnet pool, only updating
with a larger prefix (which is handled by the set command)

This reverts commit 063c722a110031883e9615064092644de6df8da2.

Change-Id: I11224fbdb94dc1caef42a8a64cbcebaf1dc542fe
Story: #1670230
Task: #13697

[{'account_id': 29585, 'date': '2019-02-11 17:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-11 17:39:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

This fix removes an erroneous underscore found within the function named
test_snapshot_delete within test_snapshot.py found in both volume v1 and
v2 of python-openstackclient.

Story: 2004977

commit_message:
Remove domain policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

By incorporating system scope and default roles into keystone's
default policies for domains, we've effectively made these policies
obsolete.

Related-Bug: 1806762

Change-Id: I96079b15c980de6a4ba71f49d7b39790c1115767

commit_message:
Fix help message of image add project

Only with the admin role you can use the project name with
'image add project'. With the normal member role you have to use the
project id instead. If you try to use the name, you don't receive an
error, but it won't work.

Change-Id: I61d402b39558320502dc08905b8c3a146e5e740a
Task: 29543
Story: 2002535

commit_message:
Fix the api sample docs for microversion 2.68

This patch adds the following files:

1) doc/api_samples/os-evacuate/v2.68/server-evacuate-find-host-req.json
2) doc/api_samples/os-evacuate/v2.68/server-evacuate-req.json

which were missing in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634600/
so that the "tox -e api_samples" can run without errors.

Change-Id: I248b7e172698a9bee155e72215c231da9033540a
Closes-bug: #1817915

commit_message:
Get the failed status for update prepare

Related to: https://review.openstack.org/630986
We now can get the failed status and raise an
exception with the right error message.
This will help to get the issue when something failed
in the workflow.

Print only the 'message' when update run failed instead
of the whole 'payload'

Manual Cherry pick from: I1c5c62df4ea7a9e7ea2a322798d2bb1de8d9b191
Change-Id: I1c5c62df4ea7a9e7ea2a322798d2bb1de8d9b191

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 19:54:02.000000000', 'message': "Online data migration for queued_for_delete flag

This adds an online data migration for the queued_for_delete flag
on InstanceMapping. It does this by processing instance mappings that
do not have a value set for the field (i.e. are set to NULL) and queries
instances in each cell that need to be updated.

Note that this has what looks like a scary schema change in it. When the
column was added, it was specified as default=False and this changes that
value. This is not actually a schema change, but rather just changes what
we are asking SQLAlchmey to do for us when we do an INSERT of that object
if/when a value for that field is not specified. If we had used the
'server_default' flag, that would have been encoded into the schema and
thus would require a migration to change. This patch removes it because
we need to actually be able to see those NULL values in the database in
order to efficiently use them to query for records needing to be migrated.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: I0bdadec6f6b9dd7382247213a08fa139329a0683

commit_message:
Online data migration for queued_for_delete flag

This adds an online data migration for the queued_for_delete flag
on InstanceMapping. It does this by processing instance mappings that
do not have a value set for the field (i.e. are set to NULL) and queries
instances in each cell that need to be updated.

Note that this has what looks like a scary schema change in it. When the
column was added, it was specified as default=False and this changes that
value. This is not actually a schema change, but rather just changes what
we are asking SQLAlchemy to do for us when we do an INSERT of that object
if/when a value for that field is not specified. If we had used the
'server_default' flag, that would have been encoded into the schema and
thus would require a migration to change. This patch removes it because
we need to actually be able to see those NULL values in the database in
order to efficiently use them to query for records needing to be migrated.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: I0bdadec6f6b9dd7382247213a08fa139329a0683

[{'created': '2019-02-26 18:23:10.000000000', 'message': "Disabling c-backup service for osc-functional-devstack-tips job

Since swift isn't compatible with py3 currently and disabled for
this gate job, c-backup service will always fail configuring.
The backup related tests can be handled by other jobs having swift
enabled.
The c-backup service can be enabled along with swift services once
swift is compatible with py3.
This patch disables the the c-backup service for osc-functional-devstack-tips
gate job.

Change-Id: Ifd3a4e1a15f1365107a2a1367513e2ef79bd13cc
"}]
commit_message:
Disabling c-backup service for osc-functional-devstack-tips job

Since swift isn't compatible with py3 currently and disabled for
this gate job, c-backup service will always fail configuring.
The backup related tests can be handled by other jobs having swift
enabled.
The c-backup service can be enabled along with swift services once
swift is compatible with py3.
This patch disables the the c-backup service for osc-functional-devstack-tips
gate job.

Change-Id: Ifd3a4e1a15f1365107a2a1367513e2ef79bd13cc

probably `image.find` should be tweaked to additionally do a `list(os_hidden=True)`, since hidden image can be found only this way'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-02-27 19:50:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

You may need to fix the functional tests by not using the image created in ImageTests.setUp() but creating it within the test itself.  I have found it necessary to re-write a number of functional tests to combine similar operations into fewer methods and not use setUp() to create these resources.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2019-02-27 20:22:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

I'm pretty confident, that the 'find' should be tweaked. After the image is being hidden the only possibility to find it by name is to do a list with os_hidden=True. So basically the 'find' should behave following:
- regular search with identification given (in case of hidden get 404) - like currently
- do list of all images (in case with hidden searched image will not be present) - like currently
- do list of hidden images (now we finally can find it) - new"}]

- os_hash_algo

commit_message:
Write domain scope tests for projects

This commit attempts to expose domain-scoped behavior for users with
admin, writer, and reader roles on an domain. A subsequent patch will
actually fix the API validation logic and address the security
concerns that are currently violated.

Related-Bug: 1750660
bp basic-default-roles

Change-Id: Ieba7b48bf09253c751746c557d54a68e2659e1f2

commit_message:
Add system scope project protection tests

Based on recent discussions during the Rocky PTG, the community wants
to move towards a set of reasonable default roles. This is clearly
documented in the following cross-project specification:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523973/

This commit adds testing for each of the system default roles and
how they should behave with the project API.

Related-Bug: 1750660
bp basic-default-roles

Change-Id: Icde8eb887001b0c98ae7bd7c2907009b0b7ab8b7

commit_message:
Expose app creds and new attrs in fixtures

To help enable testing authenticating with application credentials in
keystonemiddleware we need the keystoneauth token fixtures to support
application credentials. This change adds application credentials to the
fixtures along with mocking of the new access rules attribute. Additionally,
add support for the new attribute in the AccessInfoV3 object so that
it will fully represent the new structure.

bp whitelist-extension-for-app-creds

Change-Id: Ia6fece77390942ac012be1c80691ba86dc1e49b4

commit_message:
Ansible json error callback plugin

This callback plugin will write any task errors (that are not
ignore_error: true) to a log file in JSON format.

In later patches, we can add the cli and workflows to make these errors
visible via the Mistral API.

Change-Id: I72a91473511f335f8a0e40c7a786ff927113f26a
(cherry picked from commit 6e363363658e7d2508f2d341d7319c6276072e5b)

commit_message:
Extend timeout for database migration tests

Database migration tests (specifically test_walk_versions
and test_mysql_innodb) are failing due to multiple reasons
from oslo.db side mentioned in the code comments.
Increasing the timeout will allow the tests to execute
successfully on slower nodes.
This solution is adopted from manila [1] and also implemented
in neutron [2] for the same and hopefully they're not facing the
issue currently.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291397/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610003/

Change-Id: I31bdcfc12e3b8b54d5b5a6664f88df3b7dcd4fc0

[{'created': '2019-02-21 22:15:47.000000000', 'message': 'Move ipa enrollment to host_prep_tasks

This addresses a possible bug when using FreeIPA to do TLS
everywhere.

It is possible that the IPA server is not on the ctlplane.
In this case, when the nodes start up, the registration of the node
with IPA will fail, resulting in failed certificate issuance requests
later on.

We introduce a composable service to run in host_prep_tasks.
This will always run once the networks have been set up.  If the
instance has already been enrolled (by cloud-init or in an update),
then the script executed by the service will just exit.

In this iteration, we simply execute the code that the cloud-init
would have done.  In later releases, we will execute all the code
performed by novajoin-server here in ansible - and deprecate the
novajoin server.

Change-Id: I31f64c3cbd1d151e3c2a436cc3e2ec5316535087

commit_message:
Move ipa enrollment to host_prep_tasks

This addresses a possible bug when using FreeIPA to do TLS
everywhere.

It is possible that the IPA server is not on the ctlplane.
In this case, when the nodes start up, the registration of the node
with IPA will fail, resulting in failed certificate issuance requests
later on.

We introduce a composable service to run in host_prep_tasks.
This will always run once the networks have been set up.  If the
instance has already been enrolled (by cloud-init or in an update),
then the script executed by the service will just exit.

In this iteration, we simply execute the code that the cloud-init
would have done.  In later releases, we will execute all the code
performed by novajoin-server here in ansible - and deprecate the
novajoin server.

Change-Id: I31f64c3cbd1d151e3c2a436cc3e2ec5316535087
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Resolves: rhbz#1661635
Closes-Bug: #1815924
(cherry picked from commit 2a8385658543d9657ac4943e8fa096206d09fc82)

2. Isn't the stop action incompatible with the restart policy in some way? I mean even if you succeed un stopping e.g. redis, it should get restarted automatically, isn't it?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2019-02-06 14:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I hope that is totally up to paunch composer/builder/runner logic to deal with the restart policy vs actions like stop or run..."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-02-07 06:23:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Apply stop period for paunch-managed stateful svcs

Apply stop_grace_period of a 60s for stateful services managed via
paunch. That gives it time to attempt stopping it gracefully, while
applying configuration updates.

Also switch non-HA mysql template to run mysqld directly.
This is because myslqd_safe does not process the graceful stop
signals well, so we need to signal mysqld directly.
Note: mysqld_safe helps for better coverging HA clusters so
we leave it as is for the HA template.

Change-Id: I329f871b6f2509c0133823ca4c22238e3e19c76d
Related-bug: #1810690
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add functionality to manage KSM on compute nodes per role

Adds functionality whether to enable / disable KSM on compute nodes.
Especially in NFV use case one wants to disable the service and as there
is in general little benefit in overcloud nodes, KSM is disabled per
default, but can be enabled using the new NovaComputeEnableKsm role
parameter.

Change-Id: I1b8dba2e2a9ff4f5ad73a4fbc3251b5dc96fd38e

commit_message:
Tag step plays

This adds a tag step[1-5] to each of the plays within the jinja2 loop to
create our 5 deployment steps. Using these tags, it's possible to run
these plays individually if desired.

Change-Id: Ic705afbf174b4597d98c2b83041ff88dd8d6664c
(cherry picked from commit bf6efb06c7f15c3577deb8432c12295f40af30a0)

The docker based image uploader can no longer be used because the
docker service has been removed from the undercloud.

This change removes the DockerImageUploader class, relieving us of the

commit_message:
Expunge the docker uploader

The docker based image uploader can no longer be used because the
docker service has been removed from the undercloud.

This change removes the DockerImageUploader class, relieving us of the
burden of maintaining unused code.

Change-Id: I7be5915a0aee561250c16487c1fee7afd28b9036
Blueprint: podman-support

 >

I think it will be better to add Depends-On tag to os-brick repo change which will point to this patch, not reverse order. I will put Depends-On tag from os-brick repo side. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2019-02-22 13:13:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's strange that lib changes depend on client changes, but up to you.
My main point that there is a lack of info in the commit message.
os_brick *will* deprecate import from connector after your patch there."}, {'account_id': 29675, 'date': '2019-02-22 14:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> It's strange that lib changes depend on client changes, but up to
 > you.
 > My main point that there is a lack of info in the commit message.
 > os_brick *will* deprecate import from connector after your patch
 > there.
Such style imports were deprecated more than 2 years ago. Now, their support will be fully removed from os-bricks code.
LibvirtScaleIOVolumeDriverTestCase is "last known client" of such imports, so this is good idea to fix client before drop support from lib side.'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2019-02-22 19:43:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Ok, let's assume everybody knows about the os-brick feature )"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-02-25 16:44:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2019-02-26 00:06:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Why don't we drop the import from __init__() of LibvirtScaleIOVolumeDriver itself?"}, {'account_id': 29675, 'date': '2019-02-26 06:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29675, 'date': '2019-02-26 06:55:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Why don't we drop the import from __init__() of LibvirtScaleIOVolumeDriver
 > itself?

LibvirtScaleIOVolumeDriver require no changes.
os_brick drops support only for direct connector classes imports.
LibvirtScaleIOVolumeDriver uses InitiatorConnector class - factory which spawn connectors.
This is right method to do connector import for now.
I fix commit message to mention that we talk only about connector classes."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-02-26 09:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
remove deprecated os_brick import from ScaleIO driver

os_brick drops support for direct connector classes imports from
os_brick.initiator.connector module.
Remove such imports from ScaleIO driver tests.

Change-Id: I0f809069a46f0084b6ad779b27c88246f8ceef00

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/?expanded=update-extra-specification-for-volume-type-detail,delete-extra-specification-for-volume-type-detail,show-volume-type-detail-detail,show-default-volume-type-detail,show-extra-specification-for-volume-type-detail,show-all-extra-specifications-for-volume-type-detail,create-or-update-extra-specs-for-volume-type-detail,update-a-volume-type-detail#show-default-volume-type

Change-Id: Ia097263b2354534fc77f229cc257bc8de8dd51dc

commit_message:
Update role policies for system admin

This change makes the policy definitions for admin role operations
consistent with other role policies. Subsequent patches will
incorporate:

 - domain user test coverage
 - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I35a2af10d47e000ee6257ce16c52c7e49a62b033
Related-Bug: 1806713

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-02-25 14:59:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2019-02-25 20:05:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Thanks Harald. Was there a discussion about using this new port.status field? I will admit that I skimmed the spec and I don't think we want the ironic-api to modify anything in the DB w/o a lock on it. Ideally, the conductor should be the one that makes any db changes.

Having said that -- even if it is in the conductor, I'm not opposed to having an explicit field instead of the internal_info dict. Although I don't yet have a good idea on what this new field will be -- eg, during the life of the port, will port.status always have a value? Because I would expect it to have a value if I were a user and saw port.status..."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-02-25 22:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Thanks Harald. Was there a discussion about using this new
 > port.status field? I will admit that I skimmed the spec and I don't
 > think we want the ironic-api to modify anything in the DB w/o a
 > lock on it. Ideally, the conductor should be the one that makes any
 > db changes.
 > 

IMO, the spec is fairly clear that the API stores the port status:
"" .. ironic API performs node-by-mac and port-by-mac lookup, to check that the respective node and port exist. The port status received in the request body is saved to the port’s internal_info['network_status'], __and then process_event is triggered__. On the conductor side, process_event will be doing ..."

Still, both you and Mark disagree. :) I'm working on addressing Marks comment's on the followup up, and will be changing it so that the conductor will store the status.

The port.status field came up on a previous iteration of the follow-on patch. Where I saw a race where storing the vif data would overwrite the network status (reset it to an old "stale" value) when stored in internal_info. This does not happen when using a separate field. Since we are putting things behind locks we would have to block/hold the event triggering the update so we would'nt have a race.

 > Having said that -- even if it is in the conductor, I'm not opposed
 > to having an explicit field instead of the internal_info dict.
 > Although I don't yet have a good idea on what this new field will
 > be -- eg, during the life of the port, will port.status always have
 > a value? Because I would expect it to have a value if I were a user
 > and saw port.status...

Despiting adding the locks, and removing the race. I think the separate field is better.

Initially when a port is created the status would not be set. As soon as a vif is attached, it will transition to one of the states ACTIVE, DOWN, BUILD, N/A, ERROR, DELETED. DELETED is not a neutron port status, but for a baremetal port this means the vif (neutron port) was deleted.

We could change it to use N/A (or DOWN) initially, prior to any vif association?'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2019-02-26 02:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build failed. For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

 > don't
 > > think we want the ironic-api to modify anything in the DB w/o a

 > check that the respective node and port exist. The port status
 > received in the request body is saved to the port’s
 > internal_info['network_status'], __and then process_event is
 > triggered__. On the conductor side, process_event will be doing
 > ..."
 > 
 > Still, both you and Mark disagree. :) I'm working on addressing
 > Marks comment's on the followup up, and will be changing it so that
 > the conductor will store the status.
 > 
 > The port.status field came up on a previous iteration of the
 > follow-on patch. Where I saw a race where storing the vif data
 > would overwrite the network status (reset it to an old "stale"
 > value) when stored in internal_info. This does not happen when
 > using a separate field. Since we are putting things behind locks we

 > soon as a vif is attached, it will transition to one of the states
 > ACTIVE, DOWN, BUILD, N/A, ERROR, DELETED. DELETED is not a neutron
 > port status, but for a baremetal port this means the vif (neutron
 > port) was deleted.
 > 
 > We could change it to use N/A (or DOWN) initially, prior to any vif
 > association?

I'm wondering if we should use the state machine support in ironic to manage this port state. It might be a nice way to catch and ignore asynchronous events arriving that are no longer relevant.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-02-26 12:05:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I'm wondering if we should use the state machine support in ironic
 > to manage this port state. It might be a nice way to catch and
 > ignore asynchronous events arriving that are no longer relevant.
 >

Can you please elaborate?
Are you suggesting we ignore events unless the state machine is in a wait state?

I'm not sure events arriving with a new state is ever irrelevant?
 If someone/something unplugged/admin down/deleted the port externally and we get an event. That is always relevant?

One thing that is certain is that relevant events will arrive while we have a node lock. When we do add_***_network we may get the event before the add_***_network call returns and we put the node in wait state."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-26 14:43:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > I'm wondering if we should use the state machine support in
 > ironic
 > > to manage this port state. It might be a nice way to catch and
 > > ignore asynchronous events arriving that are no longer relevant.
 > >
 > 
 > Can you please elaborate?
 > Are you suggesting we ignore events unless the state machine is in
 > a wait state?
 > 
 > I'm not sure events arriving with a new state is ever irrelevant?
 > If someone/something unplugged/admin down/deleted the port
 > externally and we get an event. That is always relevant?

When working with asynchronous events I find it helps to imagine adding an hour between the trigger of the event and its processing. The node could be in a completely different state, owned by a different instance, etc. So we should validate a number of things before processing it - is the state expected? Does the event's port_id match the VIF ID on the port? Is the status possible given the current state of the port/node?

Would it be possible for an event to be processed after a long delay, during which time other events have been processed for the same port?

 > 
 > One thing that is certain is that relevant events will arrive while
 > we have a node lock. When we do add_***_network we may get the
 > event before the add_***_network call returns and we put the node
 > in wait state."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2019-02-26 15:46:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Wondering if it might be more productive if we met about this, maybe with Dmitry and/or Julia (I don't know who has been paying attention to this and I only started looking at it yesterday).

We can change what is in the specs if we find out that there is something that ought to be changed. I don't think we should be updating the port w/o a lock on the port (or node, cuz I'm not sure we can lock ports directly). So regardless of whether we store the info in a new .status or in internal_info, with a lock, there won't be a conflict/data-discrepancy problem.

we need to pin down what 'status' values are, if we go that route. it seems like it is the status of the vif associated with it. I believe in a prior version, it was called network_status, and Mark wondered about it. Do people think of this as VIF? would vif_status make more sense? egs off the top of my head, if you try to create a port and do something with it which caused it to error (assuming this is possible and it is a diff error from VIF-related error), would the user expect this new status to be ERROR? or maybe the values are vif_active, vif_down, vif_build,,,?

I don't have answers to Mark's questions. My assumption had been that the node would be in some *wait (since that's what the spec sez), waiting for the events. I'd have to reread the spec, but I'd assume that if we eg timed out waiting, that any events showing up after that are handled differently (not sure what/how although right now, we just wait some x secs before proceeding so maybe we do a similar thing...)"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-26 15:56:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Wondering if it might be more productive if we met about this,
 > maybe with Dmitry and/or Julia (I don't know who has been paying
 > attention to this and I only started looking at it yesterday).
 > 
 > We can change what is in the specs if we find out that there is
 > something that ought to be changed. I don't think we should be
 > updating the port w/o a lock on the port (or node, cuz I'm not sure
 > we can lock ports directly). So regardless of whether we store the
 > info in a new .status or in internal_info, with a lock, there won't
 > be a conflict/data-discrepancy problem.
 > 
 > we need to pin down what 'status' values are, if we go that route.
 > it seems like it is the status of the vif associated with it. I
 > believe in a prior version, it was called network_status, and Mark
 > wondered about it. Do people think of this as VIF? would vif_status
 > make more sense? egs off the top of my head, if you try to create a
 > port and do something with it which caused it to error (assuming
 > this is possible and it is a diff error from VIF-related error),
 > would the user expect this new status to be ERROR? or maybe the
 > values are vif_active, vif_down, vif_build,,,?
 > 
 > I don't have answers to Mark's questions. My assumption had been
 > that the node would be in some *wait (since that's what the spec
 > sez), waiting for the events. I'd have to reread the spec, but I'd
 > assume that if we eg timed out waiting, that any events showing up
 > after that are handled differently (not sure what/how although
 > right now, we just wait some x secs before proceeding so maybe we
 > do a similar thing...)

A call might be useful, although Dmitry and Julia are away tomorrow IIRC and feature freeze is next week.

vif_status makes sense to me. I agree that the use of locks make this patch less important.

This reminds me that I had suggested splitting out VIFs into a separate object a while ago. I guess we're looking for less work here not more though :)"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2019-02-26 16:27:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> This reminds me that I had suggested splitting out VIFs into a separate object a while ago

Argh. This reminds me that we're storing the VIF ids in port.internal_info. So the port doesn't even have a real VIF-related field. When/if we decide to split out VIFs,  what would happen to this new vif_status field? I'm now tending towards using port.internal_info until we can get a better handle on what the future view might look like. It would be odd to have a vif_status but no eg vif_id field.

To deal with node lock issues when an event shows up before the node is in the *wait state, I wonder if we can have the conductor wait until the node is unlocked and in desired state (if eg node is in deploying or cleaning).

I'm not too worried about feature freeze, if we think this is close by then, it is fine. If we use internal_info, we don't need to worry about the client freeze next week :)"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-02-27 18:40:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-02-27 18:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this based on review feedback.'}]

[{'created': '2019-02-22 04:35:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add physical network to port and portgroup data model

Adds new field network_status to portgroup and port objects.
Neutron events will use this to store vif status, such as
ACTIVE, DOWN, DELETED.

Storing network status in internal_info dict has race issues
as the notification code in api and conductor both update
the same field.

Story: 1304673
Task: 29642
Change-Id: Ieb912829d1e7329471cd6c7a6ceda80c93f910ee

Change-Id: Ieb912829d1e7329471cd6c7a6ceda80c93f910ee
"}, {'created': '2019-02-27 18:40:49.000000000', 'message': "Add vif_status field to port and portgroup data model

Adds new field 'vif_status' to portgroup and port objects.
Neutron events will use this to store vif status, such
as ACTIVE, DOWN, DELETED.

The initial port status will be 'N/A', prior to any
vif association. Once a vif is associated the status
will transition to match the status of the vif
(neutron port). The DELETED state is used when the
associated vif (neutron port) was deleted.

For noop network, the state will always be 'N/A'.

Story: 1304673
Task: 29642

commit_message:
Add vif_status field to port and portgroup data model

Adds new field 'vif_status' to portgroup and port objects.
Neutron events will use this to store vif status, such
as ACTIVE, DOWN, DELETED.

The initial port status will be 'N/A', prior to any
vif association. Once a vif is associated the status
will transition to match the status of the vif
(neutron port). The DELETED state is used when the
associated vif (neutron port) was deleted.

For noop network, the state will always be 'N/A'.

Story: 1304673
Task: 29642
Change-Id: Ieb912829d1e7329471cd6c7a6ceda80c93f910ee

commit_message:
[FFU] Ensure compatibility with ansible 2.6.

Ansible 2.6 fix didn't properly selct bootstrap node. Also
new ansible changed mysql backend library making it unable
to read misformated my.cnf. This library also needs to have
socket specified if it's going to connect to local server.

Change-Id: I31b38eaf66bb899e72b1bfeca8795e5d1007eee5
Resolves: rhbz#1678235
Closes-bug: #1816422

commit_message:
Add tests for domain users interacting with services

This commit introduces some tests that show how domain users are
expected to behave with the services API. A subsequent patch will do
the same for project users.

Change-Id: I87d2229010cb84a3289b2b90f1d8b3f9ba9fd6e4
Related-Bug: 1804462

Switch functional and tempest jobs to python3

As part of the python3-first goal, add functional testing for python3
for both the functional and tempest jobs.
