subject: fix dogpile.cache issue due to the new usage of decorate in the lib
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-22 23:27:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-22 23:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-22 23:32:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-22 23:40:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-25 16:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I guess we need to adopte a similar approach than:
- https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/blob/7e8d9b0a2eb552adb6734c8570c63eb6ea2e3a7a/tests/cache/test_decorator.py#L16
- https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/blob/7e8d9b0a2eb552adb6734c8570c63eb6ea2e3a7a/tests/cache/test_decorator.py#L211

to try to keep this test'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Not sure but I guess all the others tests in this test class are wrongs since they just assert for not ``None`` and not for a real cached function'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:44:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:46:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-25 22:32:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

After playing around with this some more, it appears what is happening is that kwargs are being converted to positional args _somewhere_ in the new decorator layer in dogpile. I honestly can't tell whether this is a problem - it calls the function correctly even when I try to trip it up with different combinations of kwargs. Whether the caching is working correctly in that case I don't know (I found no indication that it wasn't, though), but I'm also not sure that's our problem. If caching of calls is broken by this new dogpile behavior then it needs to be fixed in dogpile, not oslo.cache.

I also still think we should at least open a bug with dogpile and let them know that the behavior of the non-kwarg generator changed. It's not clear to me that this was intentional (and I tend to think it wasn't), but in the best case it's possible this removes the need for a separate kwarg-compatible decorator. That's assuming this one does the right thing, and if it doesn't then that needs to be fixed anyway."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-26 16:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

as discused in the ML thread http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003197.html we think this test is out of oslo.cache scope.

so workflow -2 by waiting dogpile expert feedback.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-26 18:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-26 18:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-26 19:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Submit a patch to dogpile.cache to add some related tests cases:
https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/pull/145/files'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-26 20:31:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

I still think that ultimately we need to remove this test entirely as it's not testing oslo.cache functionality, but while we verify that dogpile has sufficient coverage of this case let's merge this to unblock the gate."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 23:27:30.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] fix dogpile.cache issue due to the new usage of decorate in the lib

Since few months ago dogpile.cache start to use the 'decorate' module
on dogpile cache region to preserve signatures within decorated functions.

Since these changes was introduced and since oslo.cache have removed
dogpile.cache version restriction this feature is now in use on oslo.cache
and they introduce an issue on unit test where we use decorator to
test return values.

This patch introduce functools to preserve functions and args and to
prevent issue due to 'decorate' on region.

Change-Id: Ic9370f36b14c1420eace874dd322183eba8df171
Closes-Bug: #1817032

and they introduce an issue on unit test where we use decorator to

This patch introduce functools to preserve functions and args and to
prevent issue due to 'decorate' on region.

[1] https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/#/c/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/+/996/

oslo.cache and they introduce an issue on unit test where we use
decorator to test return values.

This patch introduce `**kw` passed to the decorated function to prevent
issue due to 'decorator' on region.

Openstacksdk was also impacted[2] by the changes introduced in dogpile 0.7.0.

An issue was also opened on dogpile.cache side[3]

[1] https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/#/c/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/+/996/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625370/4
[3] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/issues/144

Change-Id: Ic9370f36b14c1420eace874dd322183eba8df171
Closes-Bug: #1817032
"}]
commit_message:
fix dogpile.cache issue due to the new usage of decorate in the lib

Since few months ago dogpile.cache start to use the 'decorator' module
on dogpile cache region to preserve signatures[1] within decorated
functions.

Since these changes was introduced and since oslo.cache have
removed dogpile.cache version restriction this feature is now in use on
oslo.cache and they introduce an issue on unit test where we use
decorator to test return values.

This patch introduce `**kw` passed to the decorated function to prevent
issue due to 'decorator' on region.

Openstacksdk was also impacted[2] by the changes introduced in dogpile 0.7.0.

An issue was also opened on dogpile.cache side[3]

[1] https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/#/c/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/+/996/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625370/4
[3] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/issues/144

Change-Id: Ic9370f36b14c1420eace874dd322183eba8df171
Closes-Bug: #1817032

commit_message:
Fix version return incorrect when endpoint url end without /

when request to cinder endpoint url end without /
$ curl http://127.0.0.1/volume
the version herf return incorrect, like below:
"href": "http://127.0.0.1/v2/"
"href": "http://127.0.0.1/v3/"
This patch will always add a '/' to the endpoint url end.

Closes-bug: #1816793
Change-Id: I6b0f47fc5b11c44a767e0ebfe2929e560c5f5432

commit_message:
Create iterator versions of our list functions

More often than not, folks would like to use iterators to traverse the
objects that our API gives back. This enables such a function by
creating "ilist" functions, that do exactly the same as before, but
return iterators instead of lists. This allows the uers of the API to
require less iterations on their code when they traverse the result.

The previous "list" functions now merely call the iterator version.

Change-Id: I48f97ebd6514e6c96099b506ad760a0f4635ac3a

Now that openstack-infra has new roles to build/upload/promote
artifacts from gating, we are making use of them as much as we can.

Because all of the files are completely rewritten, a new copyright
header had to be added. For those files without a copyright, the
affiliation of the author was added.

Mini-mirror was also changed:

commit_message:
Use infra pipelines and roles

Now that openstack-infra has new roles to build/upload/promote
artifacts from gating, we are making use of them as much as we can.

Mini-mirror was also changed:
- It was wrongly affiliated to SUSE, so that Copyright line was removed.
- The docker file was incorrectly named, and was therefore renamed for
  consistency.

The LOCI jobs were not updated, and will be part of another commit.

Change-Id: Ic37e634c52cb98e12568783ca6c7ac93e92ea2a7

commit_message:
Update workspace tempest.conf on changes

When updating variables that would result in a modified
tempest.conf, the /root/.tempest/etc/tempest.conf or
/etc/tempest.conf would get updated properly.  A tempest
init happens after and does not copy those into an
existing workspace.  This change allows backup workspaces
to be kept on each modification to keep from loosing any
existing workspaces.

Change-Id: Id2de9cbd0f06b73dead5298afb857df2700bab60
Closes-Bug: #1763336

subject: Fail to live migration if instance has NUMA topology
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17216, 'name': 'Martin Schuppert', 'email': 'mschuppert@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcschupp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-20 10:57:56.000000000', 'message': "Fail to live migration if instance has NUMA topology

Live migration is currently totally broken if a NUMA topology is
present. This affects everything that's been regrettably stuffed in with
NUMA topology including CPU pinning, hugepage support and emulator
thread support. Side effects can range from simple unexpected
performance hits (due to instances running on the same cores) to
complete failures (due to instance cores or huge pages being mapped to
CPUs/NUMA nodes that don't exist on the destination host).

Until such a time as we resolve these issues, we should alert users to
the fact that such issues exist. A workaround option is provided for
operators that _really_ need the broken behavior, but it's defaulted to
False to highlight the brokenness of this feature to unsuspecting
operators.

The related nova change is I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761

The proposed change exposes the 'enable_numa_live_migration'
workarounds option for TripleO deployment. By default this feature will be
disabled for NUMA topology instances.

Change-Id: I16794fbfef0e6e83d3fcebb9e6bc2fcf478ebf72
(cherry picked from commit 429cccca35b76f52499f05bd4860a6a66e148d10)
"}]
commit_message:
Fail to live migration if instance has NUMA topology

Live migration is currently totally broken if a NUMA topology is
present. This affects everything that's been regrettably stuffed in with
NUMA topology including CPU pinning, hugepage support and emulator
thread support. Side effects can range from simple unexpected
performance hits (due to instances running on the same cores) to
complete failures (due to instance cores or huge pages being mapped to
CPUs/NUMA nodes that don't exist on the destination host).

Until such a time as we resolve these issues, we should alert users to
the fact that such issues exist. A workaround option is provided for
operators that _really_ need the broken behavior, but it's defaulted to
False to highlight the brokenness of this feature to unsuspecting
operators.

The related nova change is I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761

The proposed change exposes the 'enable_numa_live_migration'
workarounds option for TripleO deployment. By default this feature will be
disabled for NUMA topology instances.

Change-Id: I16794fbfef0e6e83d3fcebb9e6bc2fcf478ebf72
(cherry picked from commit 429cccca35b76f52499f05bd4860a6a66e148d10)

commit_message:
Adding Note on SELinux for CentOS 7

As there is no maintener for the moment for selinux in the OSA project
its support was dropped. This note tells the user to disable SELinux
before the first reboot.

Change-Id: I4ab3a08172156871e19a61ff152b2f8339bfe2d3
(cherry picked from commit 65b1f90a94c43ce5e9581ecb0e74c7edb27271ee)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 16137, 'name': 'Tobias Urdin', 'email': 'tobias.urdin@binero.com', 'username': 'tobasco'}, {'_account_id': 16708, 'name': 'Kendall Nelson', 'display_name': 'Kendall (diablo_rojo)', 'email': 'kennelson11@gmail.com', 'username': 'kjnelson'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 29935, 'date': '2019-02-14 23:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-14 23:32:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2019-02-14 23:41:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This work is being done as part a student project that I'm managing. The goal to provide a clean-room drop in replacement for the GPLv3 puppet-vcsrepo library."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-02-14 23:44:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

See comments inline. You likely also want to add the new repository to the gerritbot config so the Puppet OpenStack team's IRC channel will be notified of changes to it."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-02-15 00:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh, also you need to add the project to the list in zuul/main.yaml according to: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#add-project-to-zuul'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-02-15 07:35:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why not use one of the existing git puppet modules? This one for example is community supported and Apache licensed: https://forge.puppet.com/puppet/git_resource/readme'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-02-15 15:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The idea is to provide a drop-in replacement, so this module would clean-room reimplement vcs-repo API (at least as far as git is concerned).'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-02-15 16:54:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The idea is to provide a drop-in replacement, so this module would
 > clean-room reimplement vcs-repo API (at least as far as git is
 > concerned).

Why is that required? If this is for puppet-openstack, vcsrepo is only used by two modules, puppet-tempest and puppet-ironic. It wouldn't be that much effort to rework those slightly for a new interface."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-02-15 20:46:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I haven't spidered the transitive dependencies of all Puppet OpenStack modules to see how many of them also depend on the vcsrepo module currently, but if there are more than a handful it may also be useful to be able to offer them a drop-in replacement (as long as all they need from it is Git repository management).

Discussions with Puppetlabs representatives make it clear that the vcsrepo module will have to remain GPLv2+, probably indefinitely, and I expect there are a number of consumers of it who might like to switch to an alternative with licensing consistent with other Puppetlabs-provided modules now that the majority of them have been relicensed to Apache without needing to otherwise adapt calls into it.

https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-vcsrepo/pull/381"}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2019-02-15 21:00:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

I'd be up for using the git_resource module, since it has community support. We can adjust the project goals to making the appropriate changes in OpenStack projects to use the git_resource module then shift our attention to other project goals.

+1 for not reinventing the wheel."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-18 08:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree with Chris, checking it right now the vcsrepo module is only used in three places.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-26 07:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Do you want to continue on this - or abandon it?'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

abandon'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:04:41.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Ok, let's abandon since this is not planned to move forward"}]

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639215/
Change-Id: Idd720f18893bea0ec1d26859e0a6907a5daa8980

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 15:41:31.000000000', 'message': "Reducing time.sleep(10) to time.sleep(2) on tests

The line of code in question was originally time.sleep(2), however it
was set to time.sleep(10) as part of another set of changes.  10
seconds is especially long as this sleep is used in a nested for loop.
Reducing it back to 2 seconds (assuming there is not a strong reason
to keep this at 10 seconds) should cut over 3.5 minutes off of total
amulet test run time, assuming I'm reading the code correctly.

Change-Id: I0c328e8d675d16fe3093da7af3b70fd0f879e030
"}]
commit_message:
Reducing time.sleep(10) to time.sleep(2) on tests

The line of code in question was originally time.sleep(2), however it
was set to time.sleep(10) as part of another set of changes.  10
seconds is especially long as this sleep is used in a nested for loop.
Reducing it back to 2 seconds (assuming there is not a strong reason
to keep this at 10 seconds) should cut over 3.5 minutes off of total
amulet test run time, assuming I'm reading the code correctly.

Change-Id: I0c328e8d675d16fe3093da7af3b70fd0f879e030

commit_message:
Set py3 tests according to Stein runtimes.

According to answers on the mailing list, python 3.6 is a must while
python 3.5 and 3.7 are not. So this patch drops 3.5 and sets 3.6 on
tox.ini and zuul jobs.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003205.html

Change-Id: If708bbec3a4a59261b2ce2f94580d3cdcae55c3a
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix grenade job to clone Octavia from base branch

The job was cloning Octavia always from stable/queens while all other
enabled services were being cloned from $BASE_DEVSTACK_BRANCH.

http://logs.openstack.org/64/602564/15/check/octavia-grenade/39f9e96/ \
logs/grenade_localrc.txt.gz

http://logs.openstack.org/64/602564/15/check/octavia-grenade/39f9e96/ \
logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2019-01-02_13_27_29_587

Change-Id: I3bc85588c4cac6bba24648f2793940fddc17f4a2
(cherry picked from commit cb2c5fc1a56247f0c837534156ada758f67a8d7f)

we should implement as much of the dependencies as possible for this repo, just to not expand things like that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639364/2/zuul.d/layout.yaml for other repos'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-02-27 15:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-02-27 15:08:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-02-27 15:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-02-27 15:53:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

This looks like an abuse of the job dependency feature since these jobs don't actually need anything created by the jobs on which they're depending. If the goal is to get faster feedback to developers on jobs which are failing earlier than others, we should address that directly with better interfaces rather than delay posting of final results even longer.

First, the jobs you're delaying for are ones for which developers can more easily run tests locally anyway and so these pass far more often in CI as well. Second, as you've observed, you can't actually filter whether to run the first jobs based on aspects of the change unless the jobs which depend on them are filtered by at least those same criteria."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-02-27 15:56:33.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This is something to look into for each a particular repository, we should not attempt doing global overrides as one tox/pep job can't fit all cases when implicitly consumed by other tripleo repos"}]

[{'created': '2018-05-15 09:32:12.000000000', 'message': 'Delay deployment jobs until the pep8/unit passes

Save CI resources and shorten wait-in-zuul-queue times
for other patches, when tox/pep8 checks failed.

The main concern and downside of the change is lack of
information from a deployment when developing things
but the argument is that the patch should be vetted properly
first in a local environment before taking CI resources.

Related upstream ML thread:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/
127869.html

commit_message:
Delay check CI jobs until the pep8/unit passes..

..for Greater Good.
Save CI resources and shorten wait-in-zuul-queue times
for other patches, when tox/pep8 checks failed.

The main concern and downside of the change is lack of
information from a deployment when developing things
but the argument is that the patch should be vetted properly
first in a local environment before taking CI resources.

Related upstream ML threads:
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/
127869.html
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/
2019-February/003142.html

Change-Id: I5a0f919bf1db9601456740f82271b7eddf25f13e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Convert policy.json into policy-in-code

This commit converts the existing networking-bgpvpn policy.json
into policy-in-code.

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-policy-in-code

commit_message:
Add exception to prevent overlapped segment ranges

A check is introduced to ensure the network segment range to create is
not overlapping with any existing range of the same type.

Co-authored-by: Allain Legacy <Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Partially-implements: blueprint network-segment-range-management
Change-Id: I6b011687320382f4523f074c08c24cd2e02f5718

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-18 09:07:22.000000000', 'message': 'Remove whitespace before comments

Python 2.7 ConfigParser does not accept whitespace before comments.
To keep config files produced by ansible-config_temple parsable
we will strip out the whitespace preceding comments.

Change-Id: Ie1236c4c44dc39c7172b7a02afe9c35d92ee9e0a
Closes-Bug: #1755821
'}]
commit_message:
Remove whitespace before comments

Python 2.7 ConfigParser does not accept whitespace before comments.
To keep config files produced by ansible-config_temple parsable
we will strip out the whitespace preceding comments.

Change-Id: Ie1236c4c44dc39c7172b7a02afe9c35d92ee9e0a
Closes-Bug: #1755821

commit_message:
[WIP] Falco: Add security context for pod/container

This adds the security context to the falco pod. This
This changes the default user from root to the nobody user.

Change-Id: I4d3f629ff2337c4ed7c926134c69563b1b400dfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 17:54:16.000000000', 'message': 'Skip ssh_known_hosts tasks in check mode

The tempfile task is skipped in check mode so we need to skip all tasks to
avoid referencing the undefined temp file path.

Change-Id: I87a4b40387cabed86e04efa64ddc19f117693589
Closes-Bug: 1817765
'}]
commit_message:
Skip ssh_known_hosts tasks in check mode

The tempfile task is skipped in check mode so we need to skip all tasks to
avoid referencing the undefined temp file path.

Change-Id: I87a4b40387cabed86e04efa64ddc19f117693589
Closes-Bug: 1817765

commit_message:
Adding Note on SELinux for CentOS 7

As there is no maintener for the moment for selinux in the OSA project
its support was dropped. This note tells the user to disable SELinux
before the first reboot.

Change-Id: I4ab3a08172156871e19a61ff152b2f8339bfe2d3

[{'created': '2018-10-12 14:18:24.000000000', 'message': 'Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial, now that we have
Bionic Beaver nodes that support python3.7, lets switch to testing with
python3.7 in addition with python3.6 in Stein and beyond.
See ML discussion here [1] for context. [

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

commit_message:
Deploy Templates: add 'extra' field to DB & object

The original patch [1] to add DB & object support for deploy templates
did not include an 'extra' field for metadata. This patch adds the
field, and bumps the object version.

Change-Id: I95b4beae217704defc9eab851780fd9c42847c40
Story: 1722275
Task: 29698

commit_message:
Enable nova VNC configuration on the subnode

The n-novnc service only runs on the controller node, however novnc
settings must be enabled on both nodes for vnc to work, since both
hosts are compute hosts.

Change-Id: Icc29441f507e6e4df9fd900eb7f35b0862f52043
(cherry picked from commit 05da9a9b1e86babe829c1c2349fa7e9838095ee8)

'}, {'created': '2019-02-26 01:10:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix get keyring content failed when ceph auth disabled

When ceph auth diasbled, both 'user' and 'keyring' will be 'None',
and the method _check_or_get_keyring_contents must return strings
for ceph conf file writelines() generation.

Change-Id: Ieafd40ace4f50c1a966c9097c5de270c68b0666b
Closes-Bug: #1817271
"}]
commit_message:
Fix get keyring content failed when ceph auth disabled

When ceph auth diasbled, both 'user' and 'keyring' will be 'None',
and the method _check_or_get_keyring_contents must return strings
for ceph conf file writelines() generation.

Change-Id: Ieafd40ace4f50c1a966c9097c5de270c68b0666b
Closes-Bug: #1817271

Another issue introduced by Ic8f865ed9cfc89056991ce4fa50a99c4937af33b is

Change-Id: Ib3ed5e216615667678c900942fa40265197fe0fd

commit_message:
nova: Only link OVMF_CODE.fd on EL 7

Another issue introduced by Ic8f865ed9cfc89056991ce4fa50a99c4937af33b is
that we would attempt to link to OVMF_CODE.fd when OVMF itself hasn't
been installed.

Change-Id: Ib3ed5e216615667678c900942fa40265197fe0fd

commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release. The current
target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6, so there is no reason to
keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: I3a8d2137a1d3158a476a6c23b8a6229b1dfc20f6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ensure passwordless ssh with stack between nodes

For compute migration to work, the stack user needs to be configured
with passwordless ssh between all hosts involved in the migration.

Reuse the build ssh-key for this, which is already distributed for
user root.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/563584

Change-Id: Id07f55fea06509466add35315c135dbfba6aa714
(cherry picked from commit afe141401997db054cd9987ca17d989415c65ad4)

commit_message:
placement: Duplicate db connection params

This is required to allow POI to optionally opt out of defining these
parameters against the base ::nova class when deploying Placement using
the puppet-placement module while still retaining backward compatibility
for existing puppet-nova users.

Change-Id: I5bf97f2037dc4b9aafd3d7dba5370636ff3c8bb7

[{'created': '2019-02-25 16:27:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix doc builds for ironic

It seems that the wsme sphinx extension was concealing
issues in our doc builds, where formatting was not exactly
correct nor parsed as we would always expect as we have had
a tendency to fully document data structures as if we are
typing code.

Upon disabling the extension, the prior build failures due to
duplicate labels disappeared and other issues preventing the

It also seems that we never actually used the extension as

$ grep -ir "wsme:root" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "wsme:type" ./ironic

./ironic/objects/fields.py:class FlexibleDictField(object_fields.AutoTypedField):
./ironic/objects/fields.py:class MACAddressField(object_fields.AutoTypedField):
$ grep -ir "autoattribute" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autoservice" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autofunction" ./ironic
$

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib5bbd9274a4098022fba69f0e4998485d2ee2396
Story: 2003020
Task:  23043
'}]
commit_message:
Fix doc builds for ironic

It seems that the wsme sphinx extension was concealing
issues in our doc builds, where formatting was not exactly
correct nor parsed as we would always expect as we have had
a tendency to fully document data structures as if we are
typing code.

Upon disabling the extension, the prior build failures due to
duplicate labels disappeared and other issues preventing the
docs from building successfully were raised.

It also seems that we never actually used the extension as
documented https://wsme.readthedocs.io/en/latest/document.html

$ grep -ir "wsme:root" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "wsme:type" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "wsme:attribute" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "wsme:service" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autotype" ./ironic
./ironic/objects/fields.py:class FlexibleDictField(object_fields.AutoTypedField):
./ironic/objects/fields.py:class MACAddressField(object_fields.AutoTypedField):
$ grep -ir "autoattribute" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autoservice" ./ironic
$ grep -ir "autofunction" ./ironic
$

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib5bbd9274a4098022fba69f0e4998485d2ee2396
Story: 2003020
Task:  23043

commit_message:
Bug fix: Change object definition according to the newest DB.

Controlpath should associate with device, not the deployable.
AttachHandle should associate with cpid_id, and should have "in_use" field.

Change-Id: I0ce29bfb0a1e89971d680aba6bd2a63d339fe88d

[{'created': '2018-11-09 02:51:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add python 3.6 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.6 as part of the python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

commit_message:
Add python 3.6 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.6 as part of the python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: If75ca1d09b99e52dd7eea570fed071a262f4e7a9

some cleaning

* remove unused methods
* use testools assert exceptions
* use tearDown where possible
* redundant str()

commit_message:
Use a single queue for update/upgrade

Use a single queue for update and upgrade ansible run to avoid
race while consuming both messages from the web wocket

Manual Cherry-pick from: I8b04c2a39d35f530467ddb5f2c4305c08cbc44f1

Change-Id: I8b04c2a39d35f530467ddb5f2c4305c08cbc44f1
Closes-Bug: #1804812

a small doubt: shouldn't we have the corresponding doc/api_samples files for nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-evacuate/v2.68/server-evacuate-req.json.tpl and nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-evacuate/v2.68/server-evacuate-find-host-req.json.tpl	?

when I run tox -e api-samples it seems to fail because of not being able to find the files. I was actually looking into another API change and came across this question."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-27 13:46:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> shouldn't we have the corresponding doc/api_samples files for nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-evacuate/v2.68/server-evacuate-req.json.tpl and nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-evacuate/v2.68/server-evacuate-find-host-req.json.tpl

Yes probably, the functional tests probably pass because of mocks rather than the actual doc API samples being used. Want to open a bug?"}]

commit_message:
API: Remove evacuate/live-migrate 'force' parameter

Add a new microversion that removes support for the aforementioned
argument, which cannot be adequately guaranteed in the new placement
world.

Change-Id: I2a395aa6eccad75a97fa49e993b0300bdcfc7258
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Implements: blueprint remove-force-flag-from-live-migrate-and-evacuate
APIImpact

Note: that won't work with docker containers, since they aren't managed by systemd.

In order to add support for that one, we might want to add another check, grep-ing the content of the /var/log/extras/(podman|docker)/(podman|docker)_allinfo.log and find all the "Exited (non-0)" in there.

That would do double-check for podman, but imho it's good to get an complete overview of the systemd services AND containers.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-02-19 09:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

'}, {'created': '2019-02-20 08:45:58.000000000', 'message': "Raise an error if a service or container is failed

Sometimes container or service does not start, and this
doesn't make the CI fail. Until now, the failed containers
are listed in the /var/log/extras/ tree, but it's not
checked on a regular basis.

This patch intends to make a hard failure in case either
a service or a container doesn't start as expected. The
check is done at the very end of the log collection, in
order to ensure services/container have time to start
correctly. This also ensure we get all the required logs
for debugging.

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1816523
Change-Id: I001e2f27d2b562bb0be87c8eaadcf3622e530498

commit_message:
Raise an error if a service or container is failed

Sometimes container or service does not start, and this
doesn't make the CI fail. Until now, the failed containers
are listed in the /var/log/extras/ tree, but it's not
checked on a regular basis.

This patch intends to make a hard failure in case either
a service or a container doesn't start as expected.

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1816523
Change-Id: I001e2f27d2b562bb0be87c8eaadcf3622e530498

commit_message:
Update appdirs to 1.4.3

Currently lower-constraint job fails due to changes in appdir's latest
version not included in the lower-constraints. This patch updates the
same.  This is shamelessly plagiarized from a change in neutron [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/639325

Change-Id: I9e48e0f2c4947ca8ec52fdb8c7c586382b8b66ef

[{'created': '2019-02-06 12:21:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add agent property: resources-synced

Agents supporting the guaranteed minimum bandwidth feature need to share
their resource view with neutron-server and in turn with Placement. The
success of this synchronization represented by the agent attribute
resources-synced.

commit_message:
Add agent property: resources-synced

Agents supporting the guaranteed minimum bandwidth feature need to share
their resource view with neutron-server and in turn with Placement. The
success of this synchronization represented by the agent attribute
resources-synced.

Change-Id: I764a50884d8f23bbcad25825676c897107ed8f3f
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/630999
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Add server group for cluster worker nodes

Now Magnums onlys has one server group for all master and worker nodes
per cluster, which is not very flexible for small cloud scale. For a
3+ master clusters, it's easily meeting the capacity when using hard
anti-affinity policy. This patch is proposing one server group for each
master and worker nodes group to have better flexibility.

story: 2004195

Change-Id: If11ba863a2aa538efe1e3e850084bdd33afd27d2

the AIO host and uses deployment_environment_variables to direct

from all containers which means they have no default route
and must retrieve all external dependencies via the proxy.

the neutron public ip address range during tempest tests. Instead
we add static routes to those address ranges to eth1 in the
containers and expect the host to forward via br-mgmt.

commit_message:
Add http proxy test scenario

This patch adds a test scenario which deploys a squid proxy on
the AIO host and uses deployment_environment_variables to direct
all http and https traffic through that proxy.

In order to make the test reasonably realistic eth0 is removed
from all containers which means they have no default route
and must retrieve all external dependencies via the proxy.

As eth0 is removed we can no longer use it to NAT the traffic to
the neutron public ip address range during tempest tests. Instead
we add static routes to those address ranges to eth1 in the
containers and expect the host to forward via br-mgmt.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/625312
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/625670

Change-Id: I554cfd149374f0863ac058f26862b5439c5d53d8

commit_message:
Support cephfs_volume_mode parameter

manila now [1] supports configuring an octal value for the
rwx permissions mode of the cephfs volumes and snapshots
and groups of these that back manila shares, snapshots,
and groups.

Expose this parameter in the backend manifests for manila
with cephfs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614332
Change-Id: I28410e8c5e452ada87c7e64da637c699fcb1faba
(cherry picked from commit 43df3f75947207e11ee8ea53ec90472c586ccd9b)

commit_message:
Support cephfs_volume_mode parameter

manila now [1] supports configuring an octal value for the
rwx permissions mode of the cephfs volumes and snapshots
and groups of these that back manila shares, snapshots,
and groups.

Expose this parameter in the backend manifests for manila
with cephfs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614332

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/638773
Change-Id: I0e3f841523dc0cc213100296bc352ac88eb1ff74

commit_message:
Add magnum_user_pip_packages variable

With this variable, users would be able to extend
the list of pip packages in case of needing an
extra pip package.

Currently if we need an extra pip package we need
to override the existing list.

Change-Id: Iaa94479ea780aa0b79b880327b807223f66874d6

subject: Return instance ID of worker node
messages:
[{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-25 10:58:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-25 11:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-02-25 11:14:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-25 11:24:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-27 03:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Here are the full story we discussed in today weekly meeting.

(10:09:09) flwang: schaney: are you talking about this https://review.openstack.org/639053 ?
(10:09:37) strigazi: schaney: flwang bare with me for the explanation, also this change needs more comments in the commit message ^^
(10:10:02) strigazi: in heat a resource group creates a stack with depth two
(10:10:33) strigazi: the first nested stack kube_minions has a ref_map output
(10:10:39) strigazi: which goes like this:
(10:10:45) strigazi: 0: <smth>
(10:10:51) strigazi: 1: <smth>
(10:10:52) strigazi: and so on
(10:11:29) strigazi: These indices are the minion-INDEX numbers
(10:11:48) strigazi: and the indices in the ResourceGroup
(10:12:10) strigazi: A RG supports removal_poliies
(10:12:12) strigazi: A RG supports removal_policies
(10:12:49) strigazi: which means you can pass a list of indices as a param, and heat will remove these resources from the RG
(10:13:12) brtknr: I am not clear on what is using the change made in https://review.openstack.org/639053 atm
(10:13:26) strigazi: additionally, heat will track which indices have removed and won't create them again
(10:13:31) strigazi: brtknr: bare with me
(10:13:40) strigazi: so,
(10:14:00) strigazi: in the first imlementation of removal policies in the k8s templates
(10:14:27) strigazi: the IP was used as an id in this list:
(10:14:36) strigazi: 0: private-ip-1
(10:14:42) strigazi: 1: private-ip-2
(10:14:55) strigazi: (or zero based :))
(10:15:26) strigazi: then it was changes with this commit:
(10:15:54) strigazi: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/commit/3ca2eb30369a00240a92c254c95bea6c7a60fee1
(10:16:07) strigazi: and the ref_map became like this:
(10:16:26) strigazi: 0: stack_id_of_nested_stack_0_depth_2
(10:16:32) strigazi: 1: stack_id_of_nested_stack_1_depth_2
(10:16:59) strigazi: and the above patch broke the removal policy of the resouce group
(10:17:23) strigazi: meaning, if you passed a list of ips to the removal policy after the above patch
(10:17:50) strigazi: heat wouldn't understand to whoch index in the RG that ip belonged too
(10:18:01) strigazi: that is why for flwang and schaney didn't work
(10:18:14) schaney: gotcha
(10:18:30) strigazi: flwang: now proposes a change
(10:18:37) strigazi: to make the ref_map:
(10:18:51) strigazi: 0: nova_server_uuid_0
(10:18:55) strigazi: 1: nova_server_uuid_1
(10:19:11) strigazi: you can inspect this map in current cluster like this:
(10:19:24) imdigitaljim [~jabach@198.74.35.9] entered the room.
(10:19:43) colin-: sorry i'm late
(10:19:48) strigazi: openstack stack list --nested | grep <parent_stack_name> | grep kube_minions
(10:20:03) strigazi: and then show the nested stack of depth 1
(10:20:07) strigazi: you will see the list
(10:20:14) strigazi: you will see the ref_map
(10:20:15) strigazi: eg:
(10:21:41) brtknr: `openstack stack list --nested` is a nice trick!
(10:21:43) brtknr: til
(10:22:04) strigazi: http://paste.openstack.org/show/746304/
(10:22:22) strigazi: this is with the IP ^^
(10:22:23) brtknr: ive always done `openstack stack resource list k8s-stack --nested-depth=4
(10:23:17) eandersson_: o/
(10:23:23) strigazi: http://paste.openstack.org/show/746305/
(10:23:40) strigazi: this is with the stack_id
(10:23:49) imdigitaljim: \o
(10:23:51) strigazi: check uuid b4e8a1ec-0b76-48cb-b486-2a5459ea45d4
(10:24:01) strigazi: in the ref_map and in the list of stacks
(10:24:24) imdigitaljim: i like the new change to uuid =)
(10:24:54) flwang: imdigitaljim: yep, uuid is more reliable than ip for some cases
(10:24:55) strigazi: after said change, we will see the nova uuid there
(10:25:24) strigazi: so, in heat we can pass either the server uuid or the index
(10:25:36) strigazi: then heat will store the removed ids here:
(10:26:24) strigazi: http://paste.openstack.org/show/746306/
(10:26:33) strigazi: makes sense?
(10:27:36) jakeyip: sounds good to me
(10:27:52) schaney: yep! the confusion on my end was the "output" relationship to removal policy member
(10:28:30) schaney: and the nested stack vs the resource representing the stack
(10:28:37) schaney: makes sense now though
(10:29:03) strigazi: I spent a full moring with thomas on this'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:39:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:46:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:47:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:48:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1'}]

'}, {'created': '2019-02-27 03:23:23.000000000', 'message': 'Return instance ID of worker node

Return instance ID of workder node in k8s minion template so that
consumer can send API request to Heat to remove a particular
node with removal_policies. Otherwise, the consumer (e.g. AutoScaler)
has to use index to do the remove which is confusing out of the
OpenStack world.

Task: 29664
Story: 2005054

Change-Id: I6d776f62d640c72b3228460392b92df94fe56fe6
'}, {'created': '2019-02-27 09:39:34.000000000', 'message': 'Return instance ID of worker node

Return the nova instance UUID of worker nodes in kubeminion
templates. We will be able to remove resources from the
ResourceGroups based on nova instance uuid.

Backstory:
In heat a ResourceGroup creates a stack of depth 2. ResourceGroups
support removal policies to declare which resources must be removed.
This can be done by passing the index of the resource or the stack_id
of the nested stack. If a stack update call receives a list of
indices (eg [0, 5, 3]) or nested stack uuid (eg [uuidA, uuidB]), it
will remove the corresponding nested stacks.

In magnum's heat templates, a nested stack logically represents a
nova compute instance which is a cluster node. Using composition in
heat, we can change the way a resources group references the nested
stacks. This proposes to use the nova instance uuid as
'OS::stack_id'.

With this change, an external consumer of the stack (the cluster
autoscaler or an actual user) can remove resources from the
ResourceGroup using the nova instance uuid or resource index. Without
this change, a user or system  (which typically knows the name,
server uuid or ip) would have to find in which nested stack a
kubernetes node belongs too.  Resulting multiple call to heat.

The end result of this patch can be verified like this:
nested_stack_id=$(openstack stack resource show <STACK_ID_OR_NAME> kube_minions -c physical_resource_id -f value)
openstack stack show "${nested_stack_id}"

Task: 29664
Story: 2005054

Change-Id: I6d776f62d640c72b3228460392b92df94fe56fe6
'}, {'created': '2019-02-27 09:46:52.000000000', 'message': 'Return instance ID of worker node

commit_message:
Return instance ID of worker node

Return the nova instance UUID of worker nodes in kubeminion
templates. We will be able to remove resources from the
ResourceGroups based on nova instance uuid.

Backstory:
In heat a ResourceGroup creates a stack of depth 2. ResourceGroups
support removal policies to declare which resources must be removed.
This can be done by passing the index of the resource or the stack_id
of the nested stack. If a stack update call receives a list of
indices (eg [0, 5, 3]) or nested stack uuid (eg [uuidA, uuidB]), it
will remove the corresponding nested stacks.

In magnum's heat templates, a nested stack logically represents a
nova compute instance which is a cluster node. Using composition in
heat, we can change the way a resources group references the nested
stacks. This proposes to use the nova instance uuid as
'OS::stack_id'.

With this change, an external consumer of the stack (the cluster
autoscaler or an actual user) can remove resources from the
ResourceGroup using the nova instance uuid or resource index. Without
this change, a user or system  (which typically knows the name,
server uuid or ip) would have to find in which nested stack a
kubernetes node belongs too.  Resulting multiple call to heat.

The end result of this patch can be verified like this:
nested_stack_id=$(openstack stack resource show <STACK_ID_OR_NAME> kube_minions -c physical_resource_id -f value)
openstack stack show "${nested_stack_id}"

Task: 29664
Story: 2005054

Change-Id: I6d776f62d640c72b3228460392b92df94fe56fe6

This is the gate fix to unblock all other pending changes.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2019-02-15 21:32:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2019-02-16 06:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Issue is:

I guess it's due to the fact that networking-bagpipe depends on networking-sfc (because it has an sfc driver).'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2019-02-16 07:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

( networking-sfc needs an update to adjust to the removal of neutron.db.api in I8d0321487e4b406ead7a237156ef2f221fb512b9, relocated in neutron-lib)'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2019-02-16 07:15:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Well, networking-sfc master has been adjusted to cope with the relocation. But networking-bgpvpn is, via networking-bagpipe, installing the pypi release, which is much older.

I don't have a better idea than making networking-sfc part of required-projects in networking-bgpvpn zuul jobs."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-19 17:24:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

+1 to specify networking-sfc as part of required-projects. Most neutron related projects work with same releases.
Ideally they can work with released PyPI versions but it is not the real."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-19 17:35:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-19 19:48:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yeah unfortunately so.
This appears to be the same issue as in https://bugs.launchpad.net/bgpvpn/+bug/1816644  so I marked bgpvpn as affected.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-23 14:58:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Once it is approved, networking-sfc beta release will be available in PyPI and the bgpvpn gate can consume it by changing requirements.txt.
This is my expectation and I hope it works.

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-27 06:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-27 06:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2019-02-27 08:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Failure in lower-constraints: http://logs.openstack.org/58/636158/4/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/6635ded/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-27_07_03_20_557987

I see we have:

  lower-constraints.txt:appdirs==1.3.0

commit_message:
use rpc from neutron-lib

We recently removed neutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import.

This patch switches rpc uses over to neutron-lib.

This patch also wraps in a needed update to lower-constraints.txt
(cannot merge separately, because both changes are needed to
unbreak the CI)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I42fe0a9a05ead681fd2a579650218c6140e3bb3a

commit_message:
Add glance_user_pip_packages variable

With this variable, users would be able to extend
the list of pip packages in case of needing an
extra pip package.

Currently if we need an extra pip package we need
to override the existing list.

Change-Id: I59bd71a581b23574323db55f0f16194e7788e22e

commit_message:
Randomize selection of allocation candidates

Ensure a good distribution of instances across candidate hypervisors
by randomly sampling from the full set of allocation candidates
returned when scheduling new instances

Change-Id: I15b824cddef1978d910f72cd6cbb884460223ce6
Closes-Bug: 1817877

commit_message:
Add 'absent' service state

Allow deprecation of haproxy endpoints by setting the state of the
service to 'absent'. It will also now clean up any config files
when there are no backends, or the service is disabled.

Change-Id: I1db5932c559b5e04d330c114164869dd43c1cbb2
(cherry picked from commit 972ebbe5db3b5e340176640129b4dc7923ead8aa)

subject: Fix evaluation of cinder_scheduler_default_filters
messages: [{'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2019-02-25 11:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2019-02-25 12:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-02-25 13:32:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-02-25 21:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 11:14:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix evaluation of cinder_scheduler_default_filters

Change I12859167d19b9f40e3378ac08fed094a42f40bc7, merged just today,
put the evaluation of cinder_scheduler_default_filters inside an
{% if } block that it wasn't meant to be inside. As a consequence,
that setting would be ignored more often that it would be
honored.

The Rocky version of this patch must retain the "## Cinder API's
enabled" section that the patch in master removes, since Rocky does
still support the cinder_enable_v2_api option.

Change-Id: Ic5707615571e62ba2326e2ad436333bac246c8dd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix evaluation of cinder_scheduler_default_filters

Change I12859167d19b9f40e3378ac08fed094a42f40bc7, merged just today,
put the evaluation of cinder_scheduler_default_filters inside an
{% if } block that it wasn't meant to be inside. As a consequence,
that setting would be ignored more often that it would be
honored.

The Rocky version of this patch must retain the "## Cinder API's
enabled" section that the patch in master removes, since Rocky does
still support the cinder_enable_v2_api option.

Change-Id: Ic5707615571e62ba2326e2ad436333bac246c8dd

commit_message:
Introduce cinder_scheduler_default_filters

Operators may want to define specific default filters. Previously,
they could only do so via cinder_cinder_conf_overrides.

Make the cinder.conf template understand cinder_scheduler_default_filters,
a list variable that, if defined, is folded into a comma-separated
list for scheduler_default_filters in the [DEFAULT] section.

Change-Id: I12859167d19b9f40e3378ac08fed094a42f40bc7

required directly by this project.

In addition this patch adds the required-projects to the legacy jobs
in zuul.yaml (tempest-dsvm-bgpvpnn-bagpipe and fullstack jobs)

and hence getting stale code.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/22/636422/1/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and add required projects

Lower constraints jobs are failing when using depends-on with a
neutron patch due to ryu lower constraint not matching what neutron
needs for cffi [1].

This patch removes cffi from the lower-constraints as ryu is not
required directly by this project.

In addition this patch adds the required-projects to the legacy jobs
in zuul.yaml (tempest-dsvm-bgpvpnn-bagpipe and fullstack jobs)
as they are not pulling the required projects from source
and hence getting stale code.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/22/636422/1/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/
26be9d9/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-12_19_24_08_303848

Change-Id: Ib57a6093ab0de7e9668d29f638ff5352d5106e44

commit_message:
Enable overriding the service setup host python interpreter

In order to enable the service setup host python interpreter to
be changed easily, we make it a variable. This will be useful
when someone sets the service setup host to be the utility
container, because we'll be able to set this var by default.

Change-Id: I7d801847f194d733bb2e5418f64571e68d8b42ad

We do not have a maintainer at the moment for SELinux and hopefully
we will adopt the upstream openstack-selinux package, but for now

commit_message:
Drop SELinux support for CentOS 7

We do not have a maintainer at the moment for SELinux and hopefully
we will adopt the upstream openstack-selinux package, but for now
in order to let deploys in environments where SELinux is set to
permissive work, we'll have to remove these bits.

This change can be reverted whenever we have a maintainer that's
available to do the work required.

Change-Id: I61141da3a391a99cb111733eae22cc7c54ce48c6

commit_message:
Drop SELinux support for CentOS 7

We do not have a maintainer at the moment for SELinux and hopefully
we will adopt the upstream openstack-selinux package, but for now
in order to let deploys in environments where SELinux is set to
permissive work, we'll have to remove these bits.

This change can be reverted whenever we have a maintainer that's
available to do the work required.

Change-Id: I968937bcc7730faf75750971f8c72b0ea037cbd9

commit_message:
Add reno for flannel reboot fix

Change [0] fixed the issue of reseting iptables on node reboot
when flannel was configured which made pods lose connectivity.

[0] I7f6200a4966fda1cc701749bf1f37ddc492390c5

Change-Id: I07771f2c4711b0b86a53610517abdc3dad270574
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 08:54:19.000000000', 'message': 'Drop Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
is valid for pre-Stein templates in order to drop deprecation
warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

Change-Id: I1a9bcf7bc57b99326cae618df06930ae3990fab0
Closes-Bug: #1817672
'}, {'created': '2019-02-26 10:13:33.000000000', 'message': 'Revert to use of charms.openstack transport_url

commit_message:
Revert to use of charms.openstack transport_url

Drop charm specific code to build the oslo.messaging
transport_url; this is now provided as part of
charms.openstack.

Change-Id: I1a9bcf7bc57b99326cae618df06930ae3990fab0
Closes-Bug: 1817672

commit_message:
Add dnsmasq_ntp_servers variable in the main

It is possible to populate the configuration of the NTP
servers because of the already implemented jinja template
for dnsmasq.
However, the variable did not defined in the main file yet.
This commit adds the variable in order to set the value.

Change-Id: I7528e218f206352e8bc27fb2b4637f82dc0d37af

commit_message:
Update installation-lbaas.rst

1.What is the problem ?
  1) Neutron CLI is deprecated and will be removed in the future.
  2) As the other project code is updated,some steps in this doc are no longer applicable.
  3) Some steps are not specific.

2.What is the solution for the problem?
  1) Use opensatck CLI instead.
  2) Redeploy an up-to-date environment with LBaaS and refine this doc accordingly.
  3) Add some substeps and make it more specific.

Change-Id: I150ea2716d03586ed9503125acc56af144092eed
Signed-off-by: XuShimin <948026069@qq.com>

[{'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-14 08:38:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-14 14:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-14 14:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-15 03:08:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-15 03:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-15 05:15:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-15 05:22:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi Dharmendra, Phuoc. We are about to implement a Tacker plugin to index Tacker resource information into Searchlight. There's nothing needed to be changed at the Tacker side but it would be great if you guys can help to suggest what resource info we should get and where we can get those. My initial plan is to use the tacker client to list the resources and the oslo_messeging bus to get the events/notifications. Many thanks!"}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-15 05:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-16 02:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-21 08:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-21 08:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I separate the resource info indexing and self-healing features into 2 specs for better management. Please review the patch in within 2 days. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-21 08:18:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-25 08:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-26 03:00:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-02-26 03:15:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

unfortunately I checked it little late.

into ES

stop using common db mixin

Stop using CommonDbMixin as a parent class as all functionality
is available via neutron-lib.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 13:40:00.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor RabbitMQ integration

Prior to this change, the ceilometer-agent charm receives RMQ
configuration details via the ceilometer charm.  This makes it
a bit of a snowflake.

Refactor RMQ integration to require a direct relation to the
rabbitmq-server charm; information provided on this relation
will superceed any information currently provided via the
charms relation with ceilometer, ensuring that there is no
disruption to service during a charm upgrade before the new
relation is added.

Switch to using [DEFAULT]transport_url for RMQ configuration,
making use of the new ch template for SSL and HA configuration
in [oslo_messaging_rabbit].

Change-Id: Ie637ec5162461826505cea39bde6829e036fa1f2
Closes-Bug: 1817672
'}, {'created': '2019-02-26 14:11:33.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor RabbitMQ integration

commit_message:
Refactor RabbitMQ integration

Prior to this change, the ceilometer-agent charm receives RMQ
configuration details via the ceilometer charm.  This makes it
a bit of a snowflake.

Refactor RMQ integration to require a direct relation to the
rabbitmq-server charm; information provided on this relation
will superceed any information currently provided via the
charms relation with ceilometer, ensuring that there is no
disruption to service during a charm upgrade before the new
relation is added.

Switch to using [DEFAULT]transport_url for RMQ configuration,
making use of the new ch template for SSL and HA configuration
in [oslo_messaging_rabbit].

Change-Id: Ie637ec5162461826505cea39bde6829e036fa1f2
Closes-Bug: 1817672

commit_message:
Revert "Remove host-config-and-reboot interface"

This reverts commit 2a8719960103d2619e908290d80235e6079c334d.

BootParams takes care of the kernel args configuration and
reboot via ansible. But Enabling of OVS-DPDK (EnableDpdkDeployment)
is still handled as part of the PreNetworkConfig (host_config_and_reboot).
It can be cleaned-up to remove unused bits, but not the entire stack.

Change-Id: Ifeb029ddaeb2bc60f43abdb8bdb02a4c911ace30

commit_message:
Add vitrage-dashboard integration tests

This patch adds basic tests to verify that vitrage-dashboard is
installed and could be opened.

Also it removes oslotest which is not used.

vitrage-dashboard-integration-tests job is added in a non-voting mode.

Change-Id: I03c6a28014a73605b72441a0241e1dc1cd3f908c

commit_message:
Use transport_url for Ocata or later

Add a new template for Ocata based on the Mitaka template.

Switch Ocata and Queens templates to use parts from openstack layer
for [DEFAULT]transport_url and remaining [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
HA and SSL configuration options.

Change-Id: If4effe782d61fd0d2f29a6e56cce623af7b324a3
Closes-Bug: 1817672

[{'created': '2019-02-26 09:17:26.000000000', 'message': 'Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop

commit_message:
Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

The above change requires a sync from charm-helpers.

Additionally the transport_url directive has been moved to the
[DEFAULT] section.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop
deprecation warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

Change-Id: I77e3437a5241c9ded2ef5000639f984222bc4803
Closes-Bug: #1817672

commit_message:
Add OS-limitation in the devstack_setup doc

Now it's not available to install cyborg using devstack
on Ubuntu higher than 16.04 now.

Before the restrictions are removed, it's recommended to add
a reminder to the document to avoid invalid installation.

Change-Id: I2e8b4932f5efec3cf6112dcb6cbcb336a9fd4c08
Story: 2004683
Task: 28686

commit_message:
Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

The above change requires a sync from charm-helpers.

Additionally the transport_url directive has been moved to the
[DEFAULT] section.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop
deprecation warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

test_300_neutron_config is also removed in this change as amulet
tests no longer need to confirm config file settings.

Change-Id: I3c22b6ca1992b3c20ed83afc430545999096d370
Closes-Bug: #1817672

commit_message:
Drop python-keystone and add python-keystonemiddleware

Python 2 support has been removed from the keystone package in
Disco (Stein), therefore there is no longer a python-keystone
binary package. python-keystone doesn't appear to be used by the
charm. python-keystonemiddleware, however, is used by the charm.

This change can safely be applied from Mitaka onwards.

Change-Id: I9aa6d66761ffa4f64a8573f3b0ab1e20b9c4f774

commit_message:
Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

The above change requires a sync from charm-helpers.

Additionally the transport_url directive has been moved to the
[DEFAULT] section.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop
deprecation warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

test_300_neutron_config is also removed in this change as amulet
tests no longer need to confirm config file settings.

Change-Id: I4b95c3ff4a37a09e7df5fb5cb6331dc3a46c0095
Closes-Bug: #1817672

section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,

commit_message:
Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

The above change requires a sync from charm-helpers.

Additionally the transport_url directive has been moved to the
[DEFAULT] section.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop
deprecation warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

test_300_glance_api_default_config is also removed in this change
as amulet tests no longer need to confirm config file settings.

Change-Id: I02c02f71669433ea719dffae42073771a40f743a
Closes-Bug: #1817672

commit_message:
Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

The above change requires a sync from charm-helpers.

Additionally the transport_url directive has been moved to the
[DEFAULT] section.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop
deprecation warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

test_300_nova_config is also removed in this change as amulet tests
no longer need to confirm config file settings.

Change-Id: I63e5abfecb45d097afed14d082cb91457c4fa60b
Closes-Bug: #1817672

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB bootstrap issues on CentOS

Those issues intermittently show up in various branches,
in all cases it's wrong path used to resolveip binary.
Similar to the recent kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source job failures.

Change-Id: I8cce42b60897e4ceb8d3b0bd5181fda88b10c2b8
(cherry picked from commit 38c0a4f2d210dea95b97675fb29d12f656a19bf8)

commit_message:
fix gate

A few fixes to get the tricircle gate working:
- Remove the depend on neutron common exception.
- Update lower-constraints for unneeded version constraining.
- The changes from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596420/
- Adds neutron and sfc to the functional playbook
- Separates the neutron and networking-sfc requirements into
sibling-requirements.txt so they are not picked up by devstack and
updates tox.ini as needed for them.

Change-Id: Icd6b36e613456b4af35eaf70ef95b4ef32ddf806
Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>
Co-Authored-By: tangzhuo <ztang@hnu.edu.cn>, zhiyuan_cai <luckyvega.g@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ensure created symlink is in $PATH

With "sudo", the $PATH is overriden an really basic:
PATH=/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin
It doesn't list the /usr/local/(s)bin, hence the created
symlink wasn't seen by the script.

It also push that symlink creation in the __new__ special
method in order to make it cleaner.

Finaly, it takes care of lint/pep8 failures, not related to
this change (how is that even possible?!)

Co-Authored-By: Natal Ngétal <hobbestigrou@erakis.eu>
Closes-Bug: 1817365
Partial-Bug: 1816446

Change-Id: If09eb32f43b2c26c8cd8a89f2e862db1dd91dfed

commit_message:
Fix firewall rule 'shared' check in updating fwp

This commit fixes 'shared' validation for existing firewall rules in
updating firewall policy with 'non-shared' to 'shared'.

Change-Id: I172632679f59e2aff79624753e1ef01f7ba1fdab
Closes-Bug: #1816740

commit_message:
Configure keystone haproxy endpoints through dynamic resource

This sets the hieradata to configure the keystone dynamic resource
through a dynamic resource.

Change-Id: I030c08a625a6f4e2f9dd0458af7e1d6cd1e5a2b0
Needed-By: I7a98d19f2d748e8d7006bed5f8c1314a131745ae

subject: Rely on dynamic haproxy endpoints to configure keystone

commit_message:
Rely on dynamic haproxy endpoints to configure keystone

this removes the 'keystone_enabled' hiera calls and instead relies on
the dynamic resource for the keystone haproxy endpoints. This then takes
hieradata and creates the relevant endpoints in a similar fashion as the
firewall rules are created.

Change-Id: I7a98d19f2d748e8d7006bed5f8c1314a131745ae
Depends-On: I030c08a625a6f4e2f9dd0458af7e1d6cd1e5a2b0

commit_message:
Remove empty default for SSLKey

Since the commit this is on top of [1] enables TLS by deafult. We no
longer need this empty default here.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558424

Change-Id: Ica1218859e169f486ef2c71fef74955047f54472

messages:
[{'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-05-09 11:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-05-14 11:00:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-05-15 08:55:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-05-15 19:40:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

is there any docs where ops are recommended to use an HSM as a backend for Barbican? My only concern with this feature is giving ops a false sense of security since the barbican key is stored on a configuration file on the same undercloud node. If someone walks away with that disk from a data center the data that is encrypted by swift could still be vulnerable since all the information to decrypt it still also stored on the same disk.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-05-15 22:18:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Yea i'm not sure this is much benefit without a properly configured barbican.  I don't think we need more services on the undercloud as well. Do we also understand any performance impacts of switching this? 


Also release note."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-05-16 04:46:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What do you mean "without a properly configured barbican"? this deploys barbican.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-05-16 14:04:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So I mean a barbican with an external hsm or something to that effect. Is a standalone barbican w/o an hsm high enough security?  I feel it's like the equivalent of self-signed certs which is ok for dev/test but not something you should be necessarily running in production.  I kinda feel the same about how we've enabled tls by default but in this case I think it adds even more overhead on an already loaded undercloud.  I'm not totally against it but we do need a release note somewhere :D"}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-02-27 05:58:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 11:48:31.000000000', 'message': "Use swift object encryption by default

In order to use secure defaults, we enable swift object encryption by
default in the undercloud. This has very little impact on the deployer,
as previously unencrypted objects will stay unencrypted; it'll only be
new objects that get encrypted. The deployer (and the services that use
swift) will keep using swift as if nothing changed, except that new
objects will be encrypted at rest.

Change-Id: I7f62b3385bdb1e664e607c5b19c6713f1e13736f
"}]
commit_message:
Use swift object encryption by default

In order to use secure defaults, we enable swift object encryption by
default in the undercloud. This has very little impact on the deployer,
as previously unencrypted objects will stay unencrypted; it'll only be
new objects that get encrypted. The deployer (and the services that use
swift) will keep using swift as if nothing changed, except that new
objects will be encrypted at rest.

Change-Id: I7f62b3385bdb1e664e607c5b19c6713f1e13736f

commit_message:
Apply contraints to tempest plugins

This commit applies the constraints for the tempest plugin installation
so they won't go over the upper reqs.

Closes-Bug: 1763436

commit_message:
stop using common db mixin methods

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather
than those of the mixin.

Change-Id: Ib6d95dcbb2b03ef2a9486151e551e2e9434e1dce

commit_message:
use master upper-constraints when building tempest venv

The local requirements repo can be checked out to a stable branch,
in which case, the requirements might conflict with tempest's master
requirements.

Master branch's upper-constraints should be used when building tempest's
venv.

Closes-Bug: #1706009

Change-Id: Ifd64638cae2886671421149dbbff3a57f9c64257

commit_message:
Get the failed status for update prepare

Related to: https://review.openstack.org/630986
We now can get the failed status and raise an
exception with the right error message.
This will help to get the issue when something failed
in the workflow.

Print only the 'message' when update run failed instead
of the whole 'payload'

Manual Cherry pick from I1c5c62df4ea7a9e7ea2a322798d2bb1de8d9b191

Change-Id: I1c5c62df4ea7a9e7ea2a322798d2bb1de8d9b191

When networking-ansible is used, Ironic default interface must be set to
Neutron, otherwise Neutron ports for baremetal hosts won't get populated
with local link information.

Change-Id: I333b0be365a6824a7f0f802f6b72229cb0f8c9f1

"}]
commit_message:
Set Ironic default interface when using networking-ansible

When networking-ansible is used, Ironic default interface must be set to
Neutron, otherwise Neutron ports for baremetal hosts won't get populated
with local link information.

Closes-bug: 1815015

Change-Id: I333b0be365a6824a7f0f802f6b72229cb0f8c9f1
(cherry picked from commit b026b860c81960baace2b1ae9c603d5705f3c88e)

commit_message:
Check the router interface subnet whether used by vpn connection

When the "ROUTER_INTERFACE BEFORE_DELETE event" is triggered, we
should check the router interface subnet whether used by vpn
connection except vpn service.

Co-Authored-By: Dongcan Ye <hellochosen@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Idfba6481d23d19ec368be8d79c0450a0b158dc75
Closes-Bug: #1760562

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: Id6ac95b468f7e1f4affed50a2a694216cd72a6c5
