commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I5661c2d685b4bf2422936326db1c3d543a49f92a

commit_message:
Fix changes-before values in an instance action test

In some DBMSs (e.g. MySQL 5.7 (*1)), fractions (millisecond and
microsecond) of DateTime column is not stored by default.

*1: https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/date-and-time-type-overview.html

Fix specifying the 'changes-before' values
in the functional test for the 'instance-action-list' command.

Change-Id: I79e80088bcbf559a58aa90a831b54017af310a26
Closes-Bug: #1817064

But wasn't that the root cause of the original problem; i.e. that it always returned master? Well for the backport jobs, yes. But for the "branchful" jobs, the zuul.branch is set to master even though it's running with older, e.g. rocky or queens, paramters.

filestore. Bluestore is the default deployment method as of version
3.2 of ceph-ansible so we should test it in CI. Use pre-created
lvm_volumes parameter to avoid issue with 'ceph-volume batch'
mode which does not work on loopback devices.

Will use https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638364 to quickly disable
and then re-enable these jobs help land this without disruption.

commit_message:
Switch scenario00{1,4}-multinode-containers to Ceph bluestore

Modify scenario00{1,4}-multinode to use Ceph's bluestore in place
filestore. Bluestore is the default deployment method as of version
3.2 of ceph-ansible so we should test it in CI. Use pre-created
lvm_volumes parameter to avoid issue with 'ceph-volume batch'
mode which does not work on loopback devices.

blueprint: bluestore
Depends-On: I747ac3dca5afdc91538da40b9ed45591ac8d1662
Fixes-Bug: #1817688
(cherry-picked from commit e3f697df6e1ff57b6f9e2cf3d455984dbf1faf84)

Change-Id: Id2658ae814b580971d559af616b8ba034dff681b

Why? For rocky [1] and queens [2], the ceph job had failed because the LVM devices were not created [3]?
But wasn't that the root cause of the original problem; i.e. that it always returned master? Well for the backport jobs, yes. But for the "branchful" jobs, the zuul.branch is set to master even though it's running with older, e.g. rocky or queens, paramters.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639408/

[1] rocky: http://logs.openstack.org/51/639351/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oooq-container/d5d0dee/logs/undercloud/var/lib/mistral/overcloud/ceph-ansible/ceph_ansible_command.log.txt.gz#_2019-02-26_16_57_44_446

[2] queens: http://logs.openstack.org/52/639352/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oooq-container/6b0ab2d/logs/undercloud/var/log/mistral/ceph-install-workflow.log.txt.gz#_2019-02-26_16_56_37_250

[3] http://logs.openstack.org/52/639352/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oooq-container/6b0ab2d/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-26_15_02_29_330577'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-02-26 21:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Switch scenario00{1,4}-multinode-containers to Ceph bluestore

Modify scenario00{1,4}-multinode to use Ceph's bluestore in place
filestore. Bluestore is the default deployment method as of version
3.2 of ceph-ansible so we should test it in CI. Use pre-created
lvm_volumes parameter to avoid issue with 'ceph-volume batch'
mode which does not work on loopback devices.

blueprint: bluestore
Depends-On: I747ac3dca5afdc91538da40b9ed45591ac8d1662
Fixes-Bug: #1817688
(cherry-picked from commit e3f697df6e1ff57b6f9e2cf3d455984dbf1faf84)

Change-Id: Id2658ae814b580971d559af616b8ba034dff681b

commit_message:
Removing queens and pike from the negative match for ceph-loop role

Changes
https://review.openstack.org/639351
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639352
are switching the default for ceph to bluestore.
This patch removes the queens and pike from the negative match for the
ceph-loop role so the new set up will work with that branch too

Change-Id: I747ac3dca5afdc91538da40b9ed45591ac8d1662

commit_message:
Deprecated Keystone v2.0 and PKI tokens in Keystone RGW

The Keystone v2.0 and PKI params in ceph::rgw::keystone
is now deprecated and the functionality is removed since
the v2.0 API is now available anymore and PKI tokens is
also removed.

Change-Id: I152da5f9a83aaca27d52b85a889f9391522e3531

commit_message:
Deprecate keystone v2.0 functionality

This deprecates the rgw_keystone_version and
rgw_keystone_admin_token parameters which now
has no effect.

It makes the following parameter required as
it's now only using Keystone V3.

* rgw_keystone_admin_domain
* rgw_keystone_admin_project
* rgw_keystone_admin_user
* rgw_keystone_admin_password

Also does cleanup on documentation of parameters and
the spec testing.

Change-Id: Id4c6b564a47e583c4f6af587d9a3c97f419e90a9

commit_message:
Update vm_workload_consolidation job

the reason which changes archive policy "bool" to "low" is that
the "bool" rule does not contain the default "mean" method.

At the same time, the "low" archive policy does not contain "last"
aggregation method, so we modify the default value of the
aggregation method to "mean" which supports all the strategies.

The parameter metrics have been added to make it easier
to modify the metrics for each strategy.

reference docs:https://gnocchi.xyz/stable_3.0/rest.html#archive-policy

Change-Id: I3c356b36911b547c0fb419ac6b0a1294a14cc853

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and zun use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json module to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/zun/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=jsonutils&type=

Change-Id: Icc2d8345dd1b47a508f0c6f65671c76a7af7bd0f

commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release. The current
target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6, so there is no reason to
keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: I8fbcde0573eddc1763104e0f812f93489a1b48e3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
release os-vif 1.15.0

- os-vif 1.15.0 removes the use of brctl from the in-tree plugins.
- os-vif 1.15.0 contains minor datamodel changes for stricter
  version backleveling and intodues a create_port field in the
  VIFPortProfileOpenVSwitch object.
- os-vif 1.15.0 adds native python support for ovsdb commands.

Change-Id: If73c68ce40ed99d1f5e3dab91e505ce324b8837c
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/482226/

commit_message:
Don't look for primary_role ips in AllNodesValidationConfig

We changed the AllNodesValidationConfig to be role specific.
However, we still use primary_role_name ips.

Change-Id: I0aa1174992f6f049f1e64faea6d88e377d357bad
Closes-Bug: #1817087
(cherry picked from commit 95362173c2659e4f70d3cb4190d6512aee1d11ca)

Related-Bug: #1512880
"}]
commit_message:
Mention SR-IOV cold migration limitation in admin docs

It wasn't possible to perform a cold migration with
SR-IOV devices attached to a server until Newton.

This adds a mention of that limitation in the admin
docs on PCI pass-through. Since the note this is going
into already has a known limitation, it's re-formatted
to be a list for readability and emphasis.

Change-Id: I983107b5bf43cd46adfc8ca02e20dd30cb0b404c
Related-Bug: #1512880

commit_message:
Update logging format and config for apache reverse proxies

This updates the logging format and configuration for the apache
reverse proxies used for elasticsearch, kibana, nagios and
prometheus to enable logging of the remote clients used to access
these services

Change-Id: Id07e4294ea18203fbb890b78424a232c2d59cb82

subject: Explicitly set datefmt for logging
messages: [{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-02-19 15:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-02-19 18:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1\n\nneed to wrap with quotes I guess'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-02-19 18:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-02-21 08:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-02-21 16:04:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2019-02-27 00:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 15:52:36.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly set datefmt for logging

the defaults in Python and oslo.log are such that when using separte
config file for logging configuration (as with current default values)
the log fomat of dates containes miliseconds twice (as in sec,ms.ms).

When not provided with datefmt log formatter option, Python effectively
uses '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.%f' as a default time formatting string to
render `%(asctime)s`, but the defaults in oslo.log add another `.%f`
to it.

Since `log-date-format` oslo.log option has no effect when using separate
logging config, we need to explicitly set date format to avoid double
miliseconds rendering in date of log enties.

Change-Id: I47aa7ce96770d94b905b56d6fe4abad428f01047
"}, {'created': '2019-02-19 18:12:20.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly set datefmt for logging

the defaults in Python and oslo.log are such that when using separte
config file for logging configuration (as with current default values)
the log fomat of dates containes miliseconds twice (as in sec,ms.ms).

When not provided with datefmt log formatter option, Python effectively
uses '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.%f' as a default time formatting string to
render `%(asctime)s`, but the defaults in oslo.log add another `.%f`
to it.

Since `log-date-format` oslo.log option has no effect when using separate
logging config, we need to explicitly set date format to avoid double
miliseconds rendering in date of log enties.

Change-Id: I47aa7ce96770d94b905b56d6fe4abad428f01047
"}, {'created': '2019-02-21 08:28:42.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly set datefmt for logging

the defaults in Python [0] and oslo.log [1] are such that when using
separate config file for logging configuration (log-config-append)
the log fomat of dates containes miliseconds twice (as in sec,ms.ms)
which is exactly what is currently seen in logs of OpenStack services
deployed by openstack-helm.

When not provided with datefmt log formatter option, Python effectively
uses '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S,%f' [0] as a default time formatting string to
render `%(asctime)s`, but the defaults in oslo.log add another `.%f`
to it [1].

Since `log-date-format` oslo.log option has no effect when using
log-config-append, we need to explicitly set date format to avoid double
miliseconds rendering in date of log entries.

[0] https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/6ee41793d2204c54bdf8f477ae61d016a7eca932/Lib/logging/__init__.py#L427-L428
[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.log/tree/oslo_log/_options.py?id=7c5f8362b26313217b6c248e77be3dc8e2ef74a5#n148

Change-Id: I47aa7ce96770d94b905b56d6fe4abad428f01047
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set datefmt for logging

the defaults in Python [0] and oslo.log [1] are such that when using
separate config file for logging configuration (log-config-append)
the log fomat of dates containes miliseconds twice (as in sec,ms.ms)
which is exactly what is currently seen in logs of OpenStack services
deployed by openstack-helm.

When not provided with datefmt log formatter option, Python effectively
uses '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S,%f' [0] as a default time formatting string to
render `%(asctime)s`, but the defaults in oslo.log add another `.%f`
to it [1].

Since `log-date-format` oslo.log option has no effect when using
log-config-append, we need to explicitly set date format to avoid double
miliseconds rendering in date of log entries.

[0] https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/6ee41793d2204c54bdf8f477ae61d016a7eca932/Lib/logging/__init__.py#L427-L428
[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.log/tree/oslo_log/_options.py?id=7c5f8362b26313217b6c248e77be3dc8e2ef74a5#n148

Change-Id: I47aa7ce96770d94b905b56d6fe4abad428f01047

commit_message:
Enable nova VNC configuration on the subnode

The n-novnc service only runs on the controller node, however novnc
settings must be enabled on both nodes for vnc to work, since both
hosts are compute hosts.

Change-Id: Icc29441f507e6e4df9fd900eb7f35b0862f52043

commit_message:
Ensure passwordless ssh with stack between nodes

For compute migration to work, the stack user needs to be configured
with passwordless ssh between all hosts involved in the migration.

Reuse the build ssh-key for this, which is already distributed for
user root.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/563584

Change-Id: Id07f55fea06509466add35315c135dbfba6aa714

'}, {'created': '2019-02-22 10:04:11.000000000', 'message': 'Do not bind mount the ovn_db folder for the ovn pcmk restart bundle

It does not exist and podman will error out if the folder is not there.
Tested this on a rhel8 os + f28 containers by including -e
environments/services/neutron-ovn-ha.yaml and gotten a successful
deployment:
 podman container: ovn-dbs-bundle [192.168.122.1:5000/fedora-binary-ovn-northd:pcmklatest]
   ovn-dbs-bundle-0     (ocf::ovn:ovndb-servers):       Master win1

and a pingable spawned VM afterwards.

Change-Id: I7ab069d287f5b30120ac94079712f4024fabe85c
'}]
commit_message:
Do not bind mount the ovn_db folder for the ovn pcmk restart bundle

It does not exist and podman will error out if the folder is not there.
Tested this on a rhel8 os + f28 containers by including -e
environments/services/neutron-ovn-ha.yaml and gotten a successful
deployment:
 podman container: ovn-dbs-bundle [192.168.122.1:5000/fedora-binary-ovn-northd:pcmklatest]
   ovn-dbs-bundle-0     (ocf::ovn:ovndb-servers):       Master win1

and a pingable spawned VM afterwards.

Change-Id: I7ab069d287f5b30120ac94079712f4024fabe85c

commit_message:
Add 4 l7rule types into Octavia CLI

Add 4 types into l7rule, which are:
['SSL_CONN_HAS_CERT', 'SSL_VERIFY_RESULT', 'SSL_DN_FIELD']
All these are for client certificate function.

Change-Id: I56971538681a2e54dc5cfe58c4b6ef99c783100f
Story: 2002165
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612271/

yet being annotated. This will avoid the race and the pods will

commit_message:
Avoid race between NP creation and pod annotation

This patch ensure that NPs are not applied to pods that have not
yet being annotated. This will avoid the race and the pods will
get their SG updated anyway when the annotation happens.

Closes-Bug: 1817318
Change-Id: Idee99993fcf5f84a1b25a6154a6a8ce487f2f3f1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 17:31:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add error logging for amphora agent exceptions

Currently we are not logging the exception information the amphora
agent provides in the case of failure. This makes troubleshooting
agent issues hard because you need access to the amphora.
This patch adds logging to capture the amphora agent exception
information in the controller log.

Change-Id: I59514f42c38fc37c7a1fbb5507cd0a15f6d545cb
(cherry picked from commit 6a8799c3dc56074b2bee4d812712c5f6987e9014)
'}]
commit_message:
Add error logging for amphora agent exceptions

Currently we are not logging the exception information the amphora
agent provides in the case of failure. This makes troubleshooting
agent issues hard because you need access to the amphora.
This patch adds logging to capture the amphora agent exception
information in the controller log.

Change-Id: I59514f42c38fc37c7a1fbb5507cd0a15f6d545cb
(cherry picked from commit 6a8799c3dc56074b2bee4d812712c5f6987e9014)

commit_message:
Add an api-design doc with design advice

This change adds a section for design advice, including a simple method
for doing resource analysis as a tool for HTTP API design.

[{'created': '2019-02-21 01:31:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Fix the leak in the cross-cell revert resize code

This was just a debug patch to figure out where the leaked
volume attachment was. This leaves FIXMEs inline since I
know where the leak is now but need to think about how to
deal with it. The CinderFixtureNewAttachFlow changes are useful
on their own so they should be split out and rebased to the
bottom of the series so they can merge faster. The functional
test changes to test_cross_cell_migrate should also be split
out to earlier changes in the series.

Change-Id: I3eaab8ab6e0dd146ed4c2a962c1019e8caab50ca
'}, {'created': '2019-02-26 16:40:42.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Fix the leak in the cross-cell revert resize code

This fixes the volume attachment leak and also addresses
a few other aggregated review comments, or at least leaves
markers for things I need to investigate. All of these
changes need to be split apart to their respective parts
of the series, I'm just rolling them up here for convenience.

Change-Id: I3eaab8ab6e0dd146ed4c2a962c1019e8caab50ca
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Fix the leak in the cross-cell revert resize code

This fixes the volume attachment leak and also addresses
a few other aggregated review comments, or at least leaves
markers for things I need to investigate. All of these
changes need to be split apart to their respective parts
of the series, I'm just rolling them up here for convenience.

Change-Id: I3eaab8ab6e0dd146ed4c2a962c1019e8caab50ca

commit_message:
Add py37 tox env

With python3.7 jobs added to the Zuul jobs, it makes sense to add this
to the tox config too so that developers can run python3.7 tests as
well.

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-02-20 13:59:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 48: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

The -1 is because I think the functional test checks are brittle due to not having any sort of retry mechanism on them. We've seen time and again in the past that functional tests that rely on a hard-coded sleep() call or rely on timing events that are interrupt or wait-driven lead to flaky tests that are hard to debug.

So, I'd really like to see a little more robustness in the check methods.

Agree with Sean that a base functional test class for all of os-vif would be great, but totally cool to do that in a followup.

Thanks, Rodolfo!

-jay"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-02-20 14:32:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-10 17:33:06.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add native implementation OVSDB API

Added native implementation OVSDB API. Both APIs are accesible
via configuration file. The default one is the CLI vsctl.

A new configuration variable, ``ovsdb_connection``, is added to
define the connection string for the OVSDB backend.

Added functional tests to vif_plug_ovs. This commit also includes
the base functions to execute functional tests and a set of them
to test the OVSDB APIs: native and ovs-vsctl.

REVIEWERS: functional tests were added to ensure both implementations,
vsctl and native, are working. If needed, I can split this commit in two
patches: one for the native implementation and the other one for the
functional tests.

Change-Id: I86fbf8c67572e51889eb091d7bff7f9350b52481
Closes-Bug: #1666917

commit_message:
Add native implementation OVSDB API

Added native implementation OVSDB API. Both APIs may be enabled
via configuration file. The default one is the CLI vsctl.

A new configuration variable, ``ovsdb_connection``, is added to
define the connection string for the OVSDB backend.

Added functional tests to vif_plug_ovs. This commit also includes
the base functions to execute functional tests and a set of them
to test the OVSDB APIs: native and ovs-vsctl.

Closes-Bug: #1666917
Change-Id: I86fbf8c67572e51889eb091d7bff7f9350b52481

commit_message:
container image build: introduce --use-buildah

Support Buildah instead of Docker by calling:
  $ openstack container image build --use-buildah

And it will build TripleO containers with Buildah and not Docker.

Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7608136cb213bdca81348a0c3c751b488f48d712

[{'created': '2019-02-22 16:36:06.000000000', 'message': 'Check proxy env vars

If a user is using http_proxy or https_proxy but is not excluding
localhost from being proxied via the no_proxy var it can lead to a
failure when we try and talk to the heat api. This change adds a check
that is used for both the standalone tripleo deploy command and
the undercloud install to ensure the end user does not hit this
condition.

Change-Id: I507d81278097bc3b5e23d53ae35aa26657541bfc
Closes-Bug: #1815814
(cherry picked from commit 281e01967620a2a1db1a8ef6de9d3baa18cd636e)
'}]
commit_message:
Check proxy env vars

If a user is using http_proxy or https_proxy but is not excluding
localhost from being proxied via the no_proxy var it can lead to a
failure when we try and talk to the heat api. This change adds a check
that is used for both the standalone tripleo deploy command and
the undercloud install to ensure the end user does not hit this
condition.

Change-Id: I507d81278097bc3b5e23d53ae35aa26657541bfc
Closes-Bug: #1815814
(cherry picked from commit 281e01967620a2a1db1a8ef6de9d3baa18cd636e)

As of now, due to bug 1817555, networking-sfc code cannot be pulled
from the master branch even if we specify it in 'required-projects'.
As a workaround, this commit specifies networking-sfc stein b1
in requirements.txt (and lower-constraints.txt accordingly).

Change-Id: I6142075b70231cef9a76d51f50d075081cb2d7de
Related-Bug: #1816644

commit_message:
Consume networking-sfc stein b1

As of now, due to bug 1817555, networking-sfc code cannot be pulled
from the master branch even if we specify it in 'required-projects'.
As a workaround, this commit specifies networking-sfc stein b1
in requirements.txt (and lower-constraints.txt accordingly).

Change-Id: I6142075b70231cef9a76d51f50d075081cb2d7de
Related-Bug: #1816644

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-23 21:33:55.000000000', 'message': 'Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: Id8a8be3f4e8d7f6f69371bd2df29e1b5bec90fb4
'}]
commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: Id8a8be3f4e8d7f6f69371bd2df29e1b5bec90fb4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 17:03:52.000000000', 'message': 'Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release. The current
target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6, so there is no reason to
keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: I094f862ecdc6a8b54168bc4ba6ef857b43dd7f42
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release. The current
target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6, so there is no reason to
keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: I094f862ecdc6a8b54168bc4ba6ef857b43dd7f42
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Correct fernet token sync race condition

The fernet token rotation is subject to a race condition when using
aggressive rotation in a high volume, high traffic, high capacity cloud.
This change addresses the potential race condition by converting our
fernet token sync method from rsync to scp and by sorting the fernet
keys in reverse version ordering. This will ensure that the key with
the highest index is always synchronized first and will ensure that
the underlying file structure of a given target node always remains
intact during a sync operation.

Related-Bug: 1816927
Change-Id: I9087d953f7dabe04a2ad19af6121dae71544e5b2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 28a0c5abbf654ff8b625edc0c12af50a3def2429)

commit_message:
Correct fernet token sync race condition

The fernet token rotation is subject to a race condition when using
aggressive rotation in a high volume, high traffic, high capacity cloud.

fernet token sync method from rsync to scp and by sorting the fernet

intact during a sync operation.

commit_message:
Add base job for TripleO CI baremetal jobs

While no baremetal jobs are planned for upstream CI
persently, adding the baremetal base job to tripleo-ci
keeps a consistent pattern with other base jobs.

Change-Id: I8826c7b4c93b8b6bb5e7fbeff054d845752329e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 16:21:03.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure the default version of Java is set

When installing ES and Logstash the system version of java needs to
match the expected version of java ES and Logstash will use. This
change, uses the `update-alternatives` command to set the java version
to the expected value when more than one java exists on a system.
The nessisity for this change came from OS level upgrades within
environments running OLD versions of ES. Upon upgrading the base OS
our playbooks could not complete an upgrade of ES which was due to the
java expectations. Once the alternantives were set accordingly the
upgrade completed without issues.

Change-Id: I9025967f723ee17940e11789f503e342cdad6f2a
Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Ensure the default version of Java is set

When installing ES and Logstash the system version of java needs to
match the expected version of java ES and Logstash will use. This
change, uses the `update-alternatives` command to set the java version
to the expected value when more than one java exists on a system.
The nessisity for this change came from OS level upgrades within
environments running OLD versions of ES. Upon upgrading the base OS
our playbooks could not complete an upgrade of ES which was due to the
java expectations. Once the alternantives were set accordingly the
upgrade completed without issues.

Change-Id: I9025967f723ee17940e11789f503e342cdad6f2a
Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

[{'created': '2019-02-22 01:06:34.000000000', 'message': 'Update support matrix of Huawei driver

Change-Id: Ia5d5e60b457a7df1933fa08681c5c17d8ec98f19
'}, {'created': '2019-02-25 03:43:18.000000000', 'message': 'Update support matrix of Huawei driver

Huawei F V3/V5 series is another hardware model of Huawei V3/V5
storage, and its interfaces are compatible with the old model V3/V5
storage, so current Huawei driver is able to integrate with it
compatibly.

Change-Id: Ia5d5e60b457a7df1933fa08681c5c17d8ec98f19
'}]
commit_message:
Update support matrix of Huawei driver

Huawei F V3/V5 series is another hardware model of Huawei V3/V5
storage, and its interfaces are compatible with the old model V3/V5
storage, so current Huawei driver is able to integrate with it
compatibly.

Change-Id: Ia5d5e60b457a7df1933fa08681c5c17d8ec98f19

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements.txt to releasenotes tox environment

Without these dependencies, the releasenotes build does not actually
work.

Change-Id: I6341d335003b5bd29d05314fa6f18dc66adf6f2a

[Unity] Storage-assisted migration support

Adds storage-assisted migration support for Unity driver.

Change-Id: Ibaf2e6a09f93b167b6b1477d5653922d807fccce
Implements: blueprint unity-storage-assisted-volume-migration-support

[{'created': '2019-01-30 16:47:24.000000000', 'message': 'Update README to note driverfixes usage

This replaces our normal README file with messaging about how
driverfixes branches should be used to hopefully avoid any confusion
with what is allowed and what to expect from them.

Change-Id: I55b3fa03df3b94705efba753bc094225af1e1aaa
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update README to note driverfixes usage

This replaces our normal README file with messaging about how
driverfixes branches should be used to hopefully avoid any confusion
with what is allowed and what to expect from them.

Change-Id: I55b3fa03df3b94705efba753bc094225af1e1aaa
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 19:16:03.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp SolidFire: Thin provisioning scheduler support

Thin provisioning[1] is a feature supported by SolidFire hardware but
in the current driver implementation it is not managed by Cinder.
Therefore, scheduler options to control thin provisioning would not
work in this driver.

In this patch, we make the SolidFire driver compliant with Cinder thin
provisioning framework and also fix a few values that were not being
properly reported.

To keep the driver behavior consistent and avoid breaking rolling
upgrades, a new option is added. So, by default, the driver will
behave in the old way, and in the next releases this new option will
be the new default.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/kilo/over-subscription-in-thin-provisioning.html

Change-Id: Ibba1dcf3deef27a9e1272d4e806f3e09ebd4ca4a
Closes-bug: #1784042

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Thin provisioning scheduler support

Thin provisioning[1] is a feature supported by SolidFire hardware but
in the current driver implementation it is not managed by Cinder.
Therefore, scheduler options to control thin provisioning would not
work in this driver.

In this patch, we make the SolidFire driver compliant with Cinder thin
provisioning framework and also fix a few values that were not being
properly reported.

To keep the driver behavior consistent and avoid breaking rolling
upgrades, a new option is added. So, by default, the driver will
behave in the old way, and in the next releases this new option will
be the new default.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/kilo/over-subscription-in-thin-provisioning.html

Change-Id: Ibba1dcf3deef27a9e1272d4e806f3e09ebd4ca4a
Closes-bug: #1784042

commit_message:
Support cephfs_volume_mode parameter

manila now [1] supports configuring an octal value for the
rwx permissions mode of the cephfs volumes and snapshots
and groups of these that back manila shares, snapshots,
and groups.

Expose this parameter in the backend manifests for manila
with cephfs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614332

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638770/
Change-Id: Id8cbdfeff8299ff08a84c1c5902fb909353d4678

When using mysql (and perhaps postgresql, but not sqlite), the
func.sum functionality provided in sqlalchemy will return a result
that is a decimal.Decimal. The json module is unable to cope
with this. It needs "native" types of int or float.

is added, but patches which follow this one which add integration
tests using gabbi will fail without this change in place, so if
they are passing that services as additional verification that

commit_message:
Cast Usage.usage to int

When using mysql (and perhaps postgresql, but not sqlite), the
func.sum functionality provided in sqlalchemy will return a result
that is a decimal.Decimal. The json module is unable to cope
with this. It needs "native" types of int or float.

In the case of Usage we want an int. Since there are two places
where the data is loaded, but both then directly call to create
a Usage class, do the casting in the constructor of Usage. A
unit test of that cast is added.

Since the problem does not show up in sqlite, no functional test
is added, but patches which follow this one which add integration
tests using gabbi will fail without this change in place, so if
they are passing that services as additional verification that
this is a good change.

Change-Id: I6de32d0d06b6e2427ae0cf52ed24fd0173b74baf
Closes-Bug: #1817633

> (1 comment)
Hi Sean,
I think, yes. 
I want print deprecation warning every time somebody call connector by old name and to support backward compatibility at least for two use cases:
1. connector.InitiatorConnector.factory(initiator.SCALEIO,...)
2. connector.ScaleIOConnector

I didn't find better solution to achieve this goals.
There are some alternatives, but they are quite dirty and require changes to common code to handle this specific case."}, {'account_id': 29675, 'date': '2019-02-08 06:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
rename ScaleIO connector to VxFlex OS

Dell EMC ScaleIO has been rebranded to VxFlex OS.
To follow this changes "scaleio" protocol renamed to "vxflexos",
"ScaleIOConnector" class renamed to "VxFlexOsConnector".
Old names will continue to work but will be removed in the Train
release.

Change-Id: I3bb1c985c64007c6960b6fa6f4cd893760a9a342

commit_message:
Bump appdirs to 1.4.3 in lower-constraints.txt

This will match with the version in openstack/requirements.

Change-Id: I242553d19d7b89db1547f8c78a3bd54eddfda9f4
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Expose devices/enabled_vgpu_types config option

This exposes the devices/enabled_vgpu_types config option which is required for
 vgpu support.

bp tripleo-vgpu

Change-Id: I418b5ed3ee43f8621c2997980d17fa20861d009d
(cherry picked from commit 7b6c0424a3134561c5ef1fb2436ca9a54bf7b6e3)

commit_message:
Remove redundancy in _launch_ansible* methods.

This patch tries to reuse the same function _launch_ansible
for the multiple ansible executions in tripleo_deploy.py by
passing a list with the arguments to be used by the
ansible-playbook command.

Change-Id: Iad2c9b82478ae05d68fcfd5880270105c68abefb

messages:
[{'account_id': 29995, 'date': '2019-02-25 15:27:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-25 15:29:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29995, 'date': '2019-02-25 16:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28671, 'date': '2019-02-26 07:38:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me. Keep good work on upstreaming Trove! Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 29393, 'date': '2019-02-26 15:26:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for your contribution!'}]

This patch adds access to log messages from Redis log file by searching
for the filepath in the configuration.

Change-Id: Ib9c97173ec001a002f8a9af111963849ce9208ad

commit_message:
Add log retrieval to Redis

Redis stores logs in a file defined its configuration file.

This patch adds access to log messages from Redis log file by searching
for the filepath in the configuration.

Change-Id: Ib9c97173ec001a002f8a9af111963849ce9208ad

Jon, I'm maintaining packages in Debian, and we want to have package in good shape. I've found this issue when I was testing rocky in my dev environment. I know that this issue is in librados, but please , let's merge this and leave it in master for some time until librados change will be in stable . This was discussed with Sean McGinnis, and i've promised him that i will track and remove this when librados will be stable for some time. By the way, pull request which you noted in a comment is result of my bug report to ceph guys ( after discussion with Sean). Similar change is already merged in glance_store. And change for nova is in queue. In addition, this bug is in PY3 openstack for a long time , and fix is very trivial ... Even if this will not be  removed ..it is very small change ..fixing big issue."}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2019-02-23 12:54:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Fix python3 compatibility of rbd get_fsid

In python3 librados's get_fsid() function is represented as binary.
Because of this, conditional where fsid is compared with fsid parsed
from glance's direct url is not true, then cinder-glance
acceleration is not working. This patch is fixing this.
More informations are in closing bug.

Closes-Bug: #1816468

Change-Id: I69d0685ec845355329f771f27f8894d9e988ae35

down cells.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 18:12:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix a bad granular gabbi test

A gabbi test for multiple member_of<N> was using the `query_parameters`
keyword to construct the querystring; but it was trying to test what
happens when member_of<N> is specified multiple times. In this test, N
was the same for both; so the querystring was only being constructed
with the latter value, because yaml. The test was passing spuriously
because it happens to be the case that the result would be the same if
only the latter value is specified. (If you reversed the order of the
two member_ofZ, the test failed.)

This change removes the use of `query_parameters` and just constructs
the querystring explicitly.

NB: It might be nice to find a test scenario where the false positive
wouldn't have been possible; but that would be a bigger effort that
could possibly entail reswizzling the GranularFixture and therefore the
whole gabbit. Done this way, we're at least sure that both values are
making it to the handler; and switching the order in the querystring has
no effect.

Change-Id: I10f28d8c21643be69b67f25dcc043cd9640eac42
"}, {'created': '2019-02-25 18:16:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix a bad granular gabbi test

A gabbi test for multiple member_of<N> was using the `query_parameters`
keyword to construct the querystring; but it was trying to test what
happens when member_of<N> is specified multiple times. In this test, N
was the same for both; so the querystring was only being constructed
with the latter value, because yaml [1]. The test was passing spuriously
because it happens to be the case that the result would be the same if
only the latter value is specified. (If you reversed the order of the
two member_ofZ, the test failed.)

This change removes the use of `query_parameters` and just constructs
the querystring explicitly.

NB: It might be nice to find a test scenario where the false positive
wouldn't have been possible; but that would be a bigger effort that
could possibly entail reswizzling the GranularFixture and therefore the
whole gabbit. Done this way, we're at least sure that both values are
making it to the handler; and switching the order in the querystring has
no effect.

[1] https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/165

Change-Id: I10f28d8c21643be69b67f25dcc043cd9640eac42
"}, {'created': '2019-02-25 18:31:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix a bad granular gabbi test

A gabbi test for multiple member_of<N> was using the `query_parameters`
keyword to construct the querystring; but it was trying to test what
happens when member_of<N> is specified multiple times. In this test, N
was the same for both, but the query parameters were being entered as
separate dict keys; so the querystring was only being constructed with
the latter value, because yaml [1]. The test was passing spuriously
because it happens to be the case that the result would be the same if
only the latter value is specified. (If you reversed the order of the
two member_ofZ, the test failed.)

This change re-YAMLs the query_parameters to use list syntax for the
values of the member_of key, from which gabbi will dtrt in constructing
the querystring.

NB: It might be nice to find a test scenario where the false positive
wouldn't have been possible; but that would be a bigger effort that
could possibly entail reswizzling the GranularFixture and therefore the
whole gabbit. Done this way, we're at least sure that both values are
making it to the handler; and switching the order in the querystring has
no effect (though the order is apparently not guaranteed/deterministic
anyway [2]).

[1] https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/165
[2] https://gabbi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/example.html (search for
query_parameters)

Change-Id: I10f28d8c21643be69b67f25dcc043cd9640eac42
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a bad granular gabbi test

A gabbi test for multiple member_of<N> was using the `query_parameters`
keyword to construct the querystring; but it was trying to test what
happens when member_of<N> is specified multiple times. In this test, N
was the same for both, but the query parameters were being entered as
separate dict keys; so the querystring was only being constructed with
the latter value, because yaml [1]. The test was passing spuriously
because it happens to be the case that the result would be the same if
only the latter value is specified. (If you reversed the order of the
two member_ofZ, the test failed.)

This change re-YAMLs the query_parameters to use list syntax for the
values of the member_of key, from which gabbi will dtrt in constructing
the querystring.

NB: It might be nice to find a test scenario where the false positive
wouldn't have been possible; but that would be a bigger effort that
could possibly entail reswizzling the GranularFixture and therefore the
whole gabbit. Done this way, we're at least sure that both values are
making it to the handler; and switching the order in the querystring has
no effect (though the order is apparently not guaranteed/deterministic
anyway [2]).

[1] https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/165
[2] https://gabbi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/example.html (search for
query_parameters)

Change-Id: I10f28d8c21643be69b67f25dcc043cd9640eac42

commit_message:
Remove idp policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

By incorporating system-scope and default roles, we've effectively
made these policies obsolete. We can simplify what we maintain and
provide a more consistent, unified view of default idp behavior
by removing them.

Change-Id: I6091d1cdbc4e1fa3a3d5f83a707f003416a43ea0
Closes-Bug: 1804517

Also, we can't do that patch without the work from Steve Baker to have the python uploader as a default in tripleo-common, because right now we need docker daemon to upload images into the registry."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-02-26 17:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-14 20:13:11.000000000', 'message': "Do not deploy Docker if ContainerCli is set to podman

Until we completely deprecate OS::TripleO::Services::Docker, the service
is still included into the default registry.
The simpliest way to disable Docker when Podman is enabled is to set
container_registry_deploy_docker to false, so the docker task in
ansible-role-container-registry will be ignored and docker won't be
configured nor managed. However Docker Distribution remains needed as we
don't have Crane in place right now.

Note: this patch does nothing when docker is the Container CLI, which is
the default now. This patch will only affect the deployments where
podman is actually enabled.

Change-Id: I0d8679d5d787afb963f63b1fe9c5f9d525367d51
"}]
commit_message:
Do not deploy Docker if ContainerCli is set to podman

Until we completely deprecate OS::TripleO::Services::Docker, the service
is still included into the default registry.
The simpliest way to disable Docker when Podman is enabled is to set
container_registry_deploy_docker to false, so the docker task in
ansible-role-container-registry will be ignored and docker won't be
configured nor managed. However Docker Distribution remains needed as we
don't have Crane in place right now.

Note: this patch does nothing when docker is the Container CLI, which is
the default now. This patch will only affect the deployments where
podman is actually enabled.

Change-Id: I0d8679d5d787afb963f63b1fe9c5f9d525367d51

[{'created': '2018-06-21 16:37:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add error logging for amphora agent exceptions

Currently we are not logging the exception information the amphora
agent provides in the case of failure. This makes troubleshooting
agent issues hard because you need access to the amphora.
This patch adds logging to capture the amphora agent exception
information in the controller log.

Change-Id: I59514f42c38fc37c7a1fbb5507cd0a15f6d545cb
'}]
commit_message:
Add error logging for amphora agent exceptions

Currently we are not logging the exception information the amphora
agent provides in the case of failure. This makes troubleshooting
agent issues hard because you need access to the amphora.
This patch adds logging to capture the amphora agent exception
information in the controller log.

Change-Id: I59514f42c38fc37c7a1fbb5507cd0a15f6d545cb

commit_message:
Cleanup resource provider list calls

Use -c when retrieving resource provider uuid

Using head and cut within the $() can lead to situations where messages
other than what we expect are cut before we're able to see their full
output. This can happen, for example, when commands provided by an
osc-plugin are not available for some reason. In the previous code
it's possible to see that something went wrong, but not what.

Related-Bug: #1805156
Change-Id: Id0635f512011c96e0683a26298c7382c711ac3a3

[{'created': '2018-10-18 19:58:28.000000000', 'message': "Allow Glance to run non-uwsgi when other services do

Sometimes it is useful to be able to run Glance not using uwsgi while
also allowing other services to do so. As the code was written, if the
global setting for WSGI_MODE was 'uwsgi' then glance _had_ to run using
'uwsgi' and there was no other option.

This change adds GLANCE_WSGI_MODE which defaults to the value of
WSGI_MODE, but can be overriden in local.conf. If it is any value other
that 'uwsgi', the eventlet server will be used.

This can be important because sometimes glance (in particular, because
of image uploads) and uwsgi simply don't play well together and being
able to turn it off to determine if that is the issue is useful.

Change-Id: I62c5a52aa0d30bb02843c8d5abdf76669964671f

This change adds GLANCE_WSGI_MODE which defaults to the value of

that 'uwsgi', the eventlet server will be used.

This can be important because sometimes glance (in particular, because
of image uploads) and uwsgi simply don't play well together and being
able to turn it off to determine if that is the issue is useful.

Change-Id: I62c5a52aa0d30bb02843c8d5abdf76669964671f
"}]
commit_message:
Allow Glance to run non-uwsgi when other services do

Sometimes it is useful to be able to run Glance not using uwsgi while
also allowing other services to do so. As the code was written, if the
global setting for WSGI_MODE was 'uwsgi' then glance _had_ to run using
'uwsgi' and there was no other option.

This change adds GLANCE_WSGI_MODE which defaults to the value of
WSGI_MODE, but can be overriden in local.conf. If it is any value other
that 'uwsgi', the eventlet server will be used.

This can be important because sometimes glance (in particular, because
of image uploads) and uwsgi simply don't play well together and being
able to turn it off to determine if that is the issue is useful.

Change-Id: I62c5a52aa0d30bb02843c8d5abdf76669964671f

[{'created': '2018-10-18 19:59:16.000000000', 'message': 'Unset service type in systemd unit files when non-uwsgi

If a service is stacked to run with using UWSGI, a system unit file is
written with a Service Type of "notify". This means that the exec'd
process is expected to notify systemd when it is "ready". This works
nicely with uwsgi.

If, later, the same service is reconfigured on the same machine to not
use uwsgi, the service will timeout starting up because systemd is
waiting for a notification it will never get.

This change uses 'inidelete' to remote the service type if it is already
in the unit file. If it is not the command does nothing.

Change-Id: Ib6c87b310113aca9d2f285020e1edd65174d35b6
'}, {'created': '2018-11-30 11:54:50.000000000', 'message': 'Unset service type in systemd unit files when non-uwsgi

process is expected to notify systemd when it is "ready". This works

use uwsgi, the service will timeout starting up because systemd is
waiting for a notification it will never get.

This change uses 'inidelete' to remote the service type if it is already
in the unit file. If it is not the command does nothing.

Closes-Bug: #1806023
Change-Id: Ib6c87b310113aca9d2f285020e1edd65174d35b6
'}]
commit_message:
Unset service type in systemd unit files when non-uwsgi

If a service is stacked to run with using UWSGI, a system unit file is
written with a Service Type of "notify". This means that the exec'd
process is expected to notify systemd when it is "ready". This works
nicely with uwsgi.

If, later, the same service is reconfigured on the same machine to not
use uwsgi, the service will timeout starting up because systemd is
waiting for a notification it will never get.

This change uses 'inidelete' to remote the service type if it is already
in the unit file. If it is not the command does nothing.

Closes-Bug: #1806023
Change-Id: Ib6c87b310113aca9d2f285020e1edd65174d35b6

commit_message:
Remove NOTEs about _RE_INV_IN_USE

The nova report client used to scrape the error message text to
determine whether a 409 represented an "inventory in use" scenario. As
of the dependency, it properly uses the error code instead. This change
removes notes that reference the now-dead regular expression.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568639
Change-Id: Id56a975481f360a6ddacb64c424c1c9bf49449cc

commit_message:
Dump config options on wsgi startup earlier

Before we try to setup the service record in the database
it would be good to know what configuration we're working
with so this moves the dump of the config options to before
we setup the service when running under wsgi.

Change-Id: I69c05822185cbcbe8bb777555d895a0c57c8e809

commit_message:
[docs] Add Open vSwitch Hardware Offloading (ASAP^2) Deployment Scenario

This patch adds documentation that can assist an operator in deploying
ASAP^2-accelerated[1] Open vSwitch - AKA Open vSwitch Hardware Offloading[2].
This feature requires Mellanox ConnectX-4 Lx or ConnectX-5 NICs, and can be
deployed using existing OVS and SR-IOV-related tasks in OpenStack-Ansible.

[1] http://www.mellanox.com/page/asap2?mtag=asap2
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/config-ovs-offload.html

Co-Authored-By: James Denton <james.denton@outlook.com>
Change-Id: I0c93aca73f2b809ff1e525f75496982942ea3785

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-15 14:44:12.000000000', 'message': "New agent attribute: resources_synced

Agents supporting the guaranteed minimum bandwidth feature need to share
their resource view with neutron-server and in turn with Placement too.
The resource information is synchronized to neutron-server via the
periodic agent heartbeat therefore transient synchronization errors are
fixed by the next heartbeat. But synchronization to Placement is not
done periodically, but on a (mostly) on demand basis. Therefore to fix
transient errors of the synchronization to Placement we must remember
the success/failure of the last synchronization attempt.

This change implements the extension 'agent-resources-synced' and
therefore extends the agent db model and object with a new attribute:
'resources_synced'. This attribute in only meant to be updated
internally. But it can be read via the API for debugging purposes.

APIImpact: The agent resource has a new attribute: resources_synced.

Change-Id: I757d659cea63c8172ca3618d1f581d10236f5e71
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/626210
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
New agent attribute: resources_synced

Agents supporting the guaranteed minimum bandwidth feature need to share
their resource view with neutron-server and in turn with Placement too.
The resource information is synchronized to neutron-server via the
periodic agent heartbeat therefore transient synchronization errors are
fixed by the next heartbeat. But synchronization to Placement is not
done periodically, but on a (mostly) on demand basis. Therefore to fix
transient errors of the synchronization to Placement we must remember
the success/failure of the last synchronization attempt.

This change implements the extension 'agent-resources-synced' and
therefore extends the agent db model and object with a new attribute:
'resources_synced'. This attribute in only meant to be updated
internally. But it can be read via the API for debugging purposes.

APIImpact: The agent resource has a new attribute: resources_synced.

Change-Id: I757d659cea63c8172ca3618d1f581d10236f5e71
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/626210
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

docs: Add API docs for profile, datapath offload types

Most of the docstrings that were missing have been taken from the
libvirt docs. Man, there is some tight coupling going on here.

commit_message:
Drop gpfs commands from rootwrap

Use oslo.privsep instead of rootwrap. The commands that we
removed from etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volumes:

- mmgetstate
- mmclone
- mmlsattr
- mmchattr
- mmlsconfig
- mmlspool
- mmcrfileset
- mmlsfileset
- mmlslinkfileset
- mmunlinkfileset
- mmdelfileset

Change-Id: I099a3ef919beb97f5140479366e5e22a1bc9722f
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-02-15 23:24:19.000000000', 'message': 'Remove context (and __init__) from AllocationList

AllocationList was previously saving a context arg as an instance
variable and using it in replace_all and delete_all. All calling paths

used to init the AllocationList object itself. This change adds a
context arg to replace_all and delete_all, allowing us to remove the

Change-Id: I15a4d5578799ffd86d4f1355aee8be3e90f4f695

Change-Id: I15a4d5578799ffd86d4f1355aee8be3e90f4f695

commit_message:
Remove context (and __init__) from AllocationList

AllocationList was previously saving a context arg as an instance
variable and using it in replace_all and delete_all. All calling paths
of those methods had a context in scope that was the same as the one
used to init the AllocationList object itself. This change adds a
context arg to replace_all and delete_all, allowing us to remove the
instance variable. This allows us to remove the __init__ method from
AllocationList, since it can now simply use the one from the ObjectList
superclass.

Change-Id: I15a4d5578799ffd86d4f1355aee8be3e90f4f695

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial, now that we have
Bionic Beaver nodes that support python3.7, lets switch to testing with
python3.7 in addition with python3.6 in Stein and beyond.
See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

Change-Id: I2d411598fc4e5823f641132183de02c881bbf0b4
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>
Story: #2004073
Task: #27440

subject: Implement new options to enable discard on SSDs
messages:
[{'account_id': 29625, 'date': '2019-02-19 21:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-02-20 07:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2019-02-20 13:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think the main concern was around using this on devices that do not properly support trimming.

https://github.com/ceph/ceph/pull/14727#issuecomment-328753914

There is a discussion in the PR around leaving it off by default for that reason.
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/pull/14727
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/f390704b4616c837352e7d6a8df91526cb047f0d

This is similar to what bcache does:

https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/bcache.txt
"discard
Boolean; if on a discard/TRIM will be issued to each bucket before it is reused. Defaults to off, since SATA TRIM is an unqueued command (and thus slow)."

With FileStore we relied on periodic fstrim jobs set up in the Ubuntu distro (see the links mentioned in the bug description) and this does not apply to BlueStore as no kernel file systems are mounted.'}, {'account_id': 29625, 'date': '2019-02-20 15:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-02-20 16:30:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I would rather see these changes happen via detection of capability (sata3.1 for async trim) and automatic enablement when we have the correct features'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-02-25 11:09:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Note that 'bdev_enable_discard' only works from Mimic onwards, so this config knob has no effect on anything earlier than luminous."}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-02-25 11:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

than mimic rather.'}, {'account_id': 29625, 'date': '2019-02-26 16:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Will try another approach.'}]

commit_message:
Implement new options to enable discard on SSDs

This change implements two new config.yaml options that may be used to
enable discard (trim) on bluestore devices and also make it asynchronous.

Change-Id: Icce49cead1c0a491d9cf9535cabce9b8544906f9

commit_message:
Pass resource provider mapping to neutronv2 api

The RequestSpec object contains a mapping between request groups and
resource providers fullfilling the request of the group. This patch
sends this mapping down to neutronv2 api so that the resource provider
UUID can be included in the port binding if the port requested resources.

The next patch will modify the port binding logic to use this
information.

blueprint bandwidth-resource-provider

Change-Id: Ie5ea45484a632da77c41bfe2613fa5f1dfbf19ea

subject: Recalculate request group - RP mapping during re-schedule

What about rescheduling of a resize operation?

The compute does that here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5d748001c2ffb1197ff991ca69a95865087f1010/nova/compute/manager.py#L4241

and winds up here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5d748001c2ffb1197ff991ca69a95865087f1010/nova/conductor/manager.py#L266

There are two known issues with resize reschedules though:

1. The RequestSpec is lost during a resize reschedule because compute doesn't pass it back through to the cell conductor. I'm trying to fix that here but hit some very weird serialization issue that I'm struggling to figure out:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582417/

2. Less important but resize reschedule currently requires "up-calls" to the API DB, detailed in blueprint fix-reschedule-up-calls - we have workarounds for that though.

--

Given the issues with resize reschedule, I would suggest dealing with that in a separate change, but you might want to add TODOs for it so you don't forget in this one.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-12-18 15:49:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-12-18 18:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Recalculate request group - RP mapping during re-schedule

Re-scheduling uses an alternative allocation candidate from placement to
get resource for the server. This also means that the previously
calculated request group - resource provider mapping is not valid any
more and needs to be recalculated based on the new allocation of the
server.

blueprint bandwidth-resource-provider

Change-Id: If8a13f74d2b3c99f05365eb49dcfa01d9042fefa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-18 16:20:29.000000000', 'message': 'Send resource allocations in the port binding

If the port, provided in the server create request, has requested
resources then nova needs to communicate the resource allocation it
made during the scheduling to neutron. This patch copies the
allocations into the binding profile of the port when the port is
bound.

blueprint bandwidth-resource-provider

'}, {'created': '2018-06-07 15:00:13.000000000', 'message': "Send resource allocations in the port binding

If the port, provided in the server create request, has requested
resources then nova needs to communicate the resource allocation it
made during the scheduling to neutron.

As a single neutron port's resource request is included in the
allocation candidate query as a separate request group therefore the
alloction for a port will come from a single RP. Neutron expects that
this single RP uuid is communicated during the binding of the port in
the binding_profile. Therefore nova needs to find out which RP uuid
to send to neutron for each port based on the total allocation made by
the scheduler. The current patch only implements a gready, best effort
algorithm that provides such mapping in the simple cases only.

blueprint bandwidth-resource-provider

Change-Id: Ia2e6a65690a1d7f89af0bc32fa8be30ca09472e2

alloction for a port will come from a single RP. Neutron expects that
this single RP uuid is communicated during the binding of the port in
the binding_profile. Therefore nova needs to find out which RP uuid
to send to neutron for each port based on the total allocation made by
the scheduler. The current patch only implements a gready, best effort
algorithm that provides such mapping in the simple cases only.

blueprint bandwidth-resource-provider

commit_message:
Send RP uuid in the port binding

The neturonv2/api already receives information about which resource
provider fullfills the resource needs of each neutron port. So in this
patch we include this infomation in the binding:profile of the neutron
port during the port binding.

Also make sure that this data is removed from the binding:profile when
the port is unbound.

blueprint bandwidth-resource-provider

Change-Id: Ia2e6a65690a1d7f89af0bc32fa8be30ca09472e2

Required to support Gentoo is the ability to bind mount a new shared

been created for use in per-distro variables.  For Gentoo the new bind
mounts allows the sharing of package data, shrinking both the container

commit_message:
Add gentoo support

Required to support Gentoo is the ability to bind mount a new shared
directory.  In order to support this, _lxc_container_bind_mounts has
been created for use in per-distro variables.  For Gentoo the new bind
mounts allows the sharing of package data, shrinking both the container
size and the time needed to install packages.

Also needed was the creation of the `sysctl_path` variable as Gentoo
installs sysctl to an alternate location.

Change-Id: I8c20631aff9ee30289ef2f7f862ba0d4e1bb4569

commit_message:
make functional tests run on python 3

- This change updates sanitize_log_path to
  use replace instead of string.translate so that
  it works across both python 2.7 and python 3.
- This change modifies the functional tests to run under
  python 3 by default. A new functional-py27 env is
  also added.

Change-Id: Id8127ae68cb5aeebdba73bd14fc0481cd9b773d9

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Drop deprecated rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

The above change requires a sync from charm-helpers.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop
deprecation warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

Change-Id: Id4a31a8ccfb2735d76dffe30c91c3ae733baa76b
Closes-Bug: #1817672

[{'created': '2019-02-22 09:22:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix issue with crontab enablement

The token flush and token rotate crontabs are re-written when the
leader unit changes inline with Juju leadership management.

Align contexts used to generate crontabs with Juju leadership
status, rather than corosync/pacemaker.

Correct use of OpenStackCompareReleases to ensure that releases
between ocata and queens don't automatically enable fernet
token behaviour.

Change-Id: I6db8d006ceac7b61e69f547682c5a49d876cfec6
Closes-Bug: 1816807
(cherry picked from commit 1a07a7e65731ee2585818f998638ad71d91662a0)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with crontab enablement

The token flush and token rotate crontabs are re-written when the
leader unit changes inline with Juju leadership management.

Align contexts used to generate crontabs with Juju leadership
status, rather than corosync/pacemaker.

Correct use of OpenStackCompareReleases to ensure that releases
between ocata and queens don't automatically enable fernet
token behaviour.

Change-Id: I6db8d006ceac7b61e69f547682c5a49d876cfec6
Closes-Bug: 1816807
(cherry picked from commit 1a07a7e65731ee2585818f998638ad71d91662a0)

commit_message:
Add --stack-only cli arg

--stack-only can also be used to disable the config-download workflow,
and has the same effect as --no-config-download, but with a better name.
The deprecation warning is removed as technically it's not deprecated to
deploy the Heat stack and not use the config-download workflow.

What is deprecated is using the
environments/disable-config-download-environment.yaml environment from
tripleo-heat-templates, and there is a deprecation warning in that file.

Change-Id: I78e9aa9cf4906e7b4e502f781a1ec0d94dfaebde

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I638a596f2522816dd8dd9e14a66ce483a1d2ddd3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-07 00:40:37.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regression test for bug 1794996

The _destroy_evacuated_instances method on compute
startup tries to cleanup guests from the hypervisor
and allocations held against that compute node resource
provider by evacuated instances, but doesn't take into
account that those evacuated instances could have been
deleted in the meantime which leads to a lazy-load
InstanceNotFound error that kills the startup of the
compute service.

This change adds a functional regression test to recreate
the bug. A subsequent change with the fix will update
the test to show the bug is fixed.

Note that assertFlavorMatchesAllocation and
_boot_and_check_allocations are redefined in the test
class because If6aa37d9b6b48791e070799ab026c816fda4441c
refactored those methods which will cause problems with
backports of this test. The redefined methods will be
removed in a follow up cleanup patch.

NOTE(mriedem): The restart_compute_service() method
needed to be added to the functional test class because
change I17f67a02b27a90658df48856963ea3fb327e81dc is not
in Pike.

Change-Id: I19b0d8baea5440f5d5bc49a6956d9a97bf031a05
Related-Bug: #1794996
(cherry picked from commit d252f81573cdfe7a0966f134608bb85d17311e33)
(cherry picked from commit 83d74dbbb6b45bfeada0c0b9ac13385b126709bb)
(cherry picked from commit c3fd5e5061b837a78a95705074239c3d2e41e644)

commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1794996

The _destroy_evacuated_instances method on compute
startup tries to cleanup guests from the hypervisor
and allocations held against that compute node resource
provider by evacuated instances, but doesn't take into
account that those evacuated instances could have been
deleted in the meantime which leads to a lazy-load
InstanceNotFound error that kills the startup of the
compute service.

This change adds a functional regression test to recreate
the bug. A subsequent change with the fix will update
the test to show the bug is fixed.

Note that assertFlavorMatchesAllocation and
_boot_and_check_allocations are redefined in the test
class because If6aa37d9b6b48791e070799ab026c816fda4441c
refactored those methods which will cause problems with
backports of this test. The redefined methods will be
removed in a follow up cleanup patch.

NOTE(mriedem): The restart_compute_service() method
needed to be added to the functional test class because
change I17f67a02b27a90658df48856963ea3fb327e81dc is not
in Pike.

Change-Id: I19b0d8baea5440f5d5bc49a6956d9a97bf031a05
Related-Bug: #1794996
(cherry picked from commit d252f81573cdfe7a0966f134608bb85d17311e33)
(cherry picked from commit 83d74dbbb6b45bfeada0c0b9ac13385b126709bb)
(cherry picked from commit c3fd5e5061b837a78a95705074239c3d2e41e644)

commit_message:
WIP: Debugging zuul-tox-venv issue

Tox functional test that uses site packages seems to ignore the virtual
env library in favor of the one present system-wide.

It should be the other way around, the one in the virtual env should
take precendence, and so it is in my system, so trying to figure out
what's going on at the gate.

Change-Id: I6ca994a0ed315f54ffeb38e60cbab8e4bd545121

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-06 06:06:25.000000000', 'message': 'Make rejectable_message_size configurable for log-api tests

When setting [service]max_log_size in the monasca-log-api
configuration to a value larger than the default (which is 1 MB
currently), the following tempest tests fail:

- monasca_tempest_tests.tests.log_api.test_constraints.\
  TestLogApiConstraints.test_should_reject_too_big_message
- monasca_tempest_tests.tests.log_api.test_constraints.\
  TestLogApiConstraints.test_should_reject_too_big_message_multiline

This happens because the tempest tests assume that the maximum log
size is 1 MB but that is not always the case because
[service]max_log_size can be increased to a larger value.

So add a new configuration option in tempest.conf under the
[monitoring] section to be able to set the maximum log size. This
option (called "log_api_max_log_size") should be set to the same value
than [service]max_log_size in the monasca-log-api configuration file.

Change-Id: I893c66fd640017e6cc94298207d771a3ac3b8053
Story: 2004944
Task: 29346
'}, {'created': '2019-02-06 09:05:07.000000000', 'message': 'Make rejectable_message_size configurable for log-api tests

So add a new configuration option in tempest.conf under the
[monitoring] section to be able to set the maximum log size. This
option (called "log_api_max_log_size") should be set to the same value
than [service]max_log_size in the monasca-log-api configuration file.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634308/
Change-Id: I893c66fd640017e6cc94298207d771a3ac3b8053
Story: 2004944
Task: 29346
'}]
commit_message:
Make rejectable_message_size configurable for log-api tests

When setting [service]max_log_size in the monasca-log-api
configuration to a value larger than the default (which is 1 MB
currently), the following tempest tests fail:

- monasca_tempest_tests.tests.log_api.test_constraints.\
  TestLogApiConstraints.test_should_reject_too_big_message
- monasca_tempest_tests.tests.log_api.test_constraints.\
  TestLogApiConstraints.test_should_reject_too_big_message_multiline

This happens because the tempest tests assume that the maximum log
size is 1 MB but that is not always the case because
[service]max_log_size can be increased to a larger value.

So add a new configuration option in tempest.conf under the
[monitoring] section to be able to set the maximum log size. This
option (called "log_api_max_log_size") should be set to the same value
than [service]max_log_size in the monasca-log-api configuration file.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634308/
Change-Id: I893c66fd640017e6cc94298207d771a3ac3b8053
Story: 2004944
Task: 29346

commit_message:
Support multiple ceph-fs (mds) units

Prefix the mds cephx relation key with the provided mds-name
value, ensuring that multiple ceph-fs units can be used
within a deployment.

Change-Id: I4cbfc23886552352d06cf0e96b8459b1ce84a682

commit_message:
Support multiple ceph-fs (mds) units

Prefix the mds cephx relation key with the hostname of the
local unit, ensuring that distinct cephx keys are provided
for each ceph-fs unit participating in the relation.

Change-Id: I306a312616efc8447d85ea07fb85d8dc47401714

commit_message:
Add LVM option for ceph-loop-device role

For Stein and newer create three logical volumes
for use with Ceph bluestore.

Stacked on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638363
so that so that both this and its Used-by can merge
without disruption and then 638363 can be reverted.

Used-by: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547682

Change-Id: I10426b4ff3ff17acf96fa9b17bf0ef3f89b0f542
blueprint: bluestore

commit_message:
[QUEENS-only] Use ceph-ansible during P->Q upgrade.

Change puppet-ceph-external environment file to ceph-ansible-external
during Q->R upgrade.
This is for case when environment was deployed on P release,
 where puppet-ceph is default.

Change-Id: I5fd77af70e5e7fa346157591b1d619e290a8f3d5

commit_message:
Upgrades: Ensure idempotency of pacemaker services

The fact is_bootstrap_node has to be always present regardless the
state of containerization of the service.

Change-Id: Ie39f753494d87b7cfab28d92fc6783db012cc10f
Resolves: rhbz#1652205
Closes-Bug: #1804488
(cherry picked from commit a3a7099a37663eaee15828c08b14f1212534de03)
(cherry picked from commit f56814ebe92f4f8a6e66984d8f612d3d6962b491)

commit_message:
Add second shared provider to SharedStorageFixture

To help test the new ?in_tree<N> syntax, add a second shared storage
provider to the SharedStorageFixture used in the allocation-candidates
gabbits.

Change-Id: If6d6373d4068be047d81c6c75cdf1266c9ef08a2

[{'created': '2019-02-11 20:59:31.000000000', 'message': "Test for multiple limit/group_policy qparams

Following up on [1], I tried to replace GET.getall() with GET.get() for
'limit' and 'group_policy' in the GET /allocation_candidates handler.
However, it turns out that this actually changes behavior, because
.get() picks up the *last* value, whereas we were previously picking up
the first.

Rather than spin a whole microversion to change this behavior (if we do
that, we should just change the schema to disallow multiples) this
change set just adds tests proving that we pick up the first value, so
that if future me decides to come along and make such a change again,
we'll catch it.

(NB: copied from the nova change set with the same Change-Id)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517757/37/nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/allocation_candidate.py@232

commit_message:
Test for multiple limit/group_policy qparams

Following up on [1], I tried to replace GET.getall() with GET.get() for
'limit' and 'group_policy' in the GET /allocation_candidates handler.
However, it turns out that this actually changes behavior, because
.get() picks up the *last* value, whereas we were previously picking up
the first.

Rather than spin a whole microversion to change this behavior (if we do
that, we should just change the schema to disallow multiples) this
change set just adds tests proving that we pick up the first value, so
that if future me decides to come along and make such a change again,
we'll catch it.

(NB: copied from the nova change set with the same Change-Id)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517757/37/nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/allocation_candidate.py@232

Change-Id: I3075e16fb33b2c7fd3be6bead492faf9114d18dc

commit_message:
quota: remove defaults kwarg in get_project_quotas

Both QuotaDriver.get_project_quotas() and QuotaDriver.get_user_quotas()
had a default kwarg that was never used. The only call sites for this
method are in the limits and quota-sets API handlers and none of the
call sites overrides the defaults kwarg. So, remove it. It was only
cluttering up the interface.

Change-Id: I0b7acbe7bd818ef313aefcc5f8d58277d101ce3f
