[{'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-22 21:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-23 22:39:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-25 13:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-25 14:20:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-25 14:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-25 15:19:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

When cephfs_volume_mode wasn't available how was the behavior then? Seeing as we set a default value to 0755 will this affect anything? If it's the default value in Manila we should set it to $::os_service_default and not explicitly set the default value if the default value is changed in Manila in the future."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-25 15:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The ceph_volume library (part of ceph, outside OpenStack) used to hard code the mode to 0755 and that is the value with which we want to keep backwards compatability in manila.  Even if they were to hard code a different value in the future -- which "they" won't, I did the PR to ceph to paramaterized this value -- for manila users we'd want to maintain backwards compatability with 0755 as default because that is our past behavior.  Similarly, if an OS/distribution were to change their default for ceph volume mode outside of manila we'd want *manila* to keep the old default value.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-25 16:58:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:42:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:50:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

> If it's the default value in Manila we should set it to $::os_service_default and not explicitly set the default value if the default value is changed in Manila in the future.

I agree with Tobias, 

> Similarly, if an OS/distribution were to change their default for ceph volume mode outside of manila we'd want *manila* to keep the old default value

And afaiu Tom's comment, I think he's saying the same thing... I know we won't change the default value in manila for backwards compatibility reasons, by best practice however, we should defer to service default in case puppet-manila lags behind a manila change to the default value

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/puppet-openstack-guide/latest/contributor/coding-style.html#config-file-defaults-and-parameters"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:51:01.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to cephfs_volume_mode'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-25 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-02-25 19:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Thanks, Tom!'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-25 19:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2019-02-25 20:48:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-25 22:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-26 12:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 6881e9ace4058df054d0defd75daa66dba95b203'}]

commit_message:
Support cephfs_volume_mode parameter

manila now [1] supports configuring an octal value for the
rwx permissions mode of the cephfs volumes and snapshots
and groups of these that back manila shares, snapshots,
and groups.

Expose this parameter in the backend manifests for manila
with cephfs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614332
Change-Id: I28410e8c5e452ada87c7e64da637c699fcb1faba

commit_message:
Fix logging for metrics_qdr

- metrics_qdr logs in debug mode which makes it the log file to grow quickly
- current log file path does not match with the path fluentd is tailing
- current log file patch conflicts with general purpose QDR composable service

This patch fixes all avove mentioned issues.

Change-Id: I69e0cf06d96389201258e8fb2f112aec15f64013
Resolves-Bug: #1804464
(cherry picked from commit d69e3afe3b73d687809250bf89133e0e500483c8)

[{'created': '2019-02-14 09:31:46.000000000', 'message': 'Release neutron stadium stein beta deliverables

The release model was changed in Stein release and
the neutron team only delivered neutron stein b1 only.
This causes a situation that major versions of neutron and
other stadium projects do not match and distributors are forced
to do some tricks so that neutron stein beta and rocky version
of stadium projects.

To address this situation, this commit cuts a new release of
stein b2 for neutron and stein b1 for stadium projects.

In addition, policy-in-code support in stadium projects have

Change-Id: I42839e3168cd2ae2ee13b1fe96776d3982c58838
'}, {'created': '2019-02-23 14:51:42.000000000', 'message': 'Release neutron stadium stein beta deliverables

Note that this release may help gate failures of networking-bgpvpn
and networking-bagpipe because their gates assume released beta
deliverables. These projects are wokring on migrating legacy jobs
to cope with this situations but beta deliverables from other

Change-Id: I42839e3168cd2ae2ee13b1fe96776d3982c58838
'}]
commit_message:
Release neutron stadium stein beta deliverables

The release model was changed in Stein release and
the neutron team only delivered neutron stein b1 only.
This causes a situation that major versions of neutron and
other stadium projects do not match and distributors are forced
to do some tricks so that neutron stein beta and rocky version
of stadium projects.

To address this situation, this commit cuts a new release of
stein b2 for neutron and stein b1 for stadium projects.

In addition, policy-in-code support in stadium projects have
completed, so it is a good timing to release them as well.

Note that this release may help gate failures of networking-bgpvpn
and networking-bagpipe because their gates assume released beta
deliverables. These projects are wokring on migrating legacy jobs
to cope with this situations but beta deliverables from other
neutron stadium projects would help them. This is why I prepare
beta deliverables just two weeks before Stein-3 milestone.

Change-Id: I42839e3168cd2ae2ee13b1fe96776d3982c58838

commit_message:
use rpc from neutron-lib

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import.

This patch switches rpc uses over to neutron-lib.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Change-Id: I40a4bdf03684a6e133b8dc28a0663a4f29bfb0af

commit_message:
Use transport_url for oslo.messaging configuration

Switch to using [DEFAULT]transport_url for configuration of
oslo.messaging connectivity to RabbitMQ.

Use section-oslo-messaging-rabbit to set [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
sectional configuration options for HA and SSL.

Change-Id: Ib0c4d68d76593dc29853354ee2a3815f87789caa
Closes-Bug: 1817672

commit_message:
Use transport_url for Ocata or later

Create new nova.conf template for Ocata release and
switch to using the required parts from the openstack
layer to configure [DEFAULT]transport_url and the
remaining SSL and HA options in [oslo_messaging_rabbitmq]

Change-Id: I956a2edad7e64cd14515ae562389180e2c28f195
Closes-Bug: 1817672

commit_message:
Switch scenario00{1,4}-standalone to Ceph bluestore

Modify scenario00{1,4}-standalone to use Ceph's bluestore in place
filestore. Bluestore is the default deployment method as of version
3.2 of ceph-ansible so we should test it in CI. Use pre-created
lvm_volumes parameter to avoid issue with 'ceph-volume batch'
mode which does not work on loopback devices.

Will use https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638364 to quickly disable
and then re-enable these jobs help land this without disruption.

blueprint: bluestore
Depends-On: I10426b4ff3ff17acf96fa9b17bf0ef3f89b0f542
Change-Id: Id2658ae814b580971d559af616b8ba034dff681b

commit_message:
Add fast8 tox target

The pep8 tox target in neutron runs a lot of checks which are useful
for the gate jobs but not necessary, and time consuming for the usual
daily work, which mostly includes running pep8 only on the current
change.

Currently pep8 target runs tests for
* unit test structure check
* pylint
* db migration checks
* genconfig
* bashate
* bandit, etc.

To avoid running these and run just pep8 this patch adds the new tox
target fast8.

The script tools/flake8wrap.sh is based on the script from nova,
introduced by this patch: https://review.openstack.org/205575.

Change-Id: If2e65475f6f847836ed857286facfbf00e68c633

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 18:20:18.000000000', 'message': 'Unset DB init flag on shared-db relation removal

The keystone charm sets db-initialised to true after initializing the
database the first time.  However, if the database application is
removed, this flag is not unset.

This results in breakage on attempts to re-add a shared-db relation
with a new database application, as the charm will not attempt to
re-initialize the database prior to doing DB operations.

This fix simply ensures that we unset this flag prior to finalizing
removal of the shared-db relation.

Change-Id: I78ae12fda05ce006939b2d90a3d738bacb815915
Closes-Bug: #1797229
'}, {'created': '2019-02-22 21:06:41.000000000', 'message': 'Unset DB init flag on shared-db relation removal

The keystone charm sets db-initialised to true after initializing the
database the first time.  However, if the database application is
removed, this flag is not unset.

This results in breakage on attempts to re-add a shared-db relation
with a new database application, as the charm will not attempt to
re-initialize the database prior to doing DB operations.

This fix simply ensures that we unset this flag prior to finalizing
removal of the shared-db relation.

Change-Id: I78ae12fda05ce006939b2d90a3d738bacb815915
Closes-Bug: #1797229
'}]
commit_message:
Unset DB init flag on shared-db relation removal

The keystone charm sets db-initialised to true after initializing the
database the first time.  However, if the database application is
removed, this flag is not unset.

This results in breakage on attempts to re-add a shared-db relation
with a new database application, as the charm will not attempt to
re-initialize the database prior to doing DB operations.

This fix simply ensures that we unset this flag prior to finalizing
removal of the shared-db relation.

Change-Id: I78ae12fda05ce006939b2d90a3d738bacb815915
Closes-Bug: #1797229

error. Uncommenting it fixes the issue and this var is
overridden in other roles so it would not be an issue.

Changed the path to undefined.

Change-Id: I824a33a9f622e9832fe97680cc6ab0fd99487dfb
'}, {'created': '2019-02-22 10:11:37.000000000', 'message': 'Remove always tag from preflight checking to use it as role

In order to use python_venv_build as a dependency in os_tempest
if always tag is used in preflight venv playbook, then it gets
executed when it is used as a dependency with any role which
will leads to executing other tasks. One way to is to avoid that
is to call the role only when it is needed otherwise just skip it.

Change-Id: I824a33a9f622e9832fe97680cc6ab0fd99487dfb
'}, {'created': '2019-02-26 10:29:10.000000000', 'message': "Remove always tag from preflight checking for useing as dependency

In order to use python_venv_build ansible role as a dependency
of os_tempest role. We need to disable python_venv_preflight.yml
tasks as it looks for venv_install_destination_path var, which
is commented in the role itself others above preflight
checks will run always due to 'always' tag and give
venv_install_destination_path var is not defined. In order
to avoid the above cases, we are replacing always tag with
build and install tag.

Change-Id: I824a33a9f622e9832fe97680cc6ab0fd99487dfb
"}]
commit_message:
Remove always tag from preflight checking for useing as dependency

In order to use python_venv_build ansible role as a dependency
of os_tempest role. We need to disable python_venv_preflight.yml
tasks as it looks for venv_install_destination_path var, which
is commented in the role itself others above preflight
checks will run always due to 'always' tag and give
venv_install_destination_path var is not defined. In order
to avoid the above cases, we are replacing always tag with
build and install tag.

Change-Id: I824a33a9f622e9832fe97680cc6ab0fd99487dfb

commit_message:
Fix sourcing of proxy related environment variables

Juju has changed where it stores proxy related environemnt
variables on units:
https://github.com/juju/juju/commit/223b8db274268e2ae655a71d4596f2a8f981344a

Update helper script to source from the correct location.

Change-Id: I506de446df05051acc7844323e5b5d5a5495f9bf
Closes-Bug: #1399622

commit_message:
Fix pylint R1716 (chained-comparison) refactor messages

Use "a < b < c" instead of "a < b and b < c".

Change-Id: I1f0c46a609c56ffe869486b25fe6e82faaf3d5fb

Some numbers, for those curious:

Before this change, if you have about ten security groups with 2000 rules each:

list all: 14s
list all, just 'id' field: 14s
list one: 0.6s
list one, just 'id' field: 0.6s

With this change:

list all: 14s
list all, just 'id' field: 6s
list one: 0.6s
list one, just 'id' field: 0.2s

Now where it really gets fun is when this change gets paired with its dependent change for lazy queries:

list all: 14s
list all, just 'id' field: 0.04s
list one: 0.6s
list one, just 'id' field: 0.03s

This change itself is just step one."}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2019-02-18 17:39:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

[{'created': '2019-01-11 22:16:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix slow SG api calls when limiting fields

Relating to the issue with creating rules, when reading security
groups, it is very slow. Even when limiting to id/name, it pulls
in all rules before returning just id/name.

This is one way of limiting that, though it's already been shot
down. Just adding this here as a dependent patch, after stripping
it out of the rule create patch, as a place to have a discussion,
and then work on the fix.

Change-Id: Id6870633e3943666e9b7fb900ad2d0894ee2715d

commit_message:
Fix slow SG api calls when limiting fields

Relating to the issue with creating rules, when reading security
groups, it is very slow. Even when limiting to id/name, it pulls
in all rules before returning just id/name.

This change looks at the fields requested, and if no "synthetic"
fields are in the list, skips initializing those.

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu<hongbin.lu@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1810563
Change-Id: Id6870633e3943666e9b7fb900ad2d0894ee2715d

commit_message:
Fix unbound "mac" variable

There's a DEBUG trace which is using a non existent variable in
that scope and that caused a failure when DEBUG level was enabled.

Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/tests/unit/fakes.py
	networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1816031
Change-Id: I6c77623bd199bcbb3f4ad46a7fee3b2fac325790
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a61907e6e2851b2e5c33793a727838b5ca00d330)

commit_message:
Fix unit tests and test configuration

Fix post gate hook to accommodate for new os-testr
New versions now use .stestr instead of previous .testrepository
directory

Fix ml2 plugin config import
Commit Ibc5a9ab268578c243ef13f7e0041bacd6c0c410b moved the ml2 plugin
config file, which breaks unit tests

Change-Id: Ib7541abb0bee619b87fbcc7fee5d5095255e1ec7
Closes-Bug: #1716746

backport: rocky

Not including this means that SoftwareDeployments do not have a
configured region (it's set to 'null'), and can therefore not
communicate back to the heat API. In particular, this breaks Magnum with
the following error in the journal on the deployed servers:

publicURL endpoint for orchestration service in null region not found

Change-Id: Ia2c18ef10727391812368c958262a92385374ace
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john@stackhpc.com>
Closes-Bug: #1817051
"}]
commit_message:
Configure region_name_for_services in heat.conf

backport: rocky

Not including this means that SoftwareDeployments do not have a
configured region (it's set to 'null'), and can therefore not
communicate back to the heat API. In particular, this breaks Magnum with
the following error in the journal on the deployed servers:

publicURL endpoint for orchestration service in null region not found

Change-Id: Ia2c18ef10727391812368c958262a92385374ace
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john@stackhpc.com>
Closes-Bug: #1817051

[{'created': '2018-10-22 07:33:50.000000000', 'message': 'WIP:L7rule support client certificate cases

This patch add 4 new types for SSL connection ACL configuration.

Change-Id: I71b57d0f32d4839a770396645d2b9945d24f2853
'}, {'created': '2018-10-31 08:43:18.000000000', 'message': 'WIP:L7rule support client certificate cases

This patch add 4 new types for SSL connection ACL configuration.

Change-Id: I71b57d0f32d4839a770396645d2b9945d24f2853
'}, {'created': '2018-10-31 09:30:20.000000000', 'message': 'WIP:L7rule support client certificate cases

This patch add 4 new types for SSL connection ACL configuration.

Change-Id: I71b57d0f32d4839a770396645d2b9945d24f2853
'}, {'created': '2018-11-19 09:47:48.000000000', 'message': 'L7rule support client certificate cases

This patch add 4 new types for SSL connection ACL configuration.
Which are:
L7RULE_TYPE_SSL_CONN_HAS_CERT
L7RULE_TYPE_SSL_CONN_USE_CERT
L7RULE_TYPE_VERIFY_RES
L7RULE_TYPE_DN_FIELD

The first and second types can just accept the compare type "EQUAL_TO"
and value "True" string.
The third can just accept the int value string to check the certificate
verify result, also just support "EQUAL_TO" compare type.
The fourth can accept key, which is "X-Y" format, "X" is the DN supported
field, "Y" is the index of DN part you specified, or just a DN supported
field. The value is the match string, this one supports all kind compare
types.

Story: 2002165
Task: 20025
Change-Id: I71b57d0f32d4839a770396645d2b9945d24f2853
'}, {'created': '2018-11-26 04:12:00.000000000', 'message': 'L7rule support client certificate cases

This patch add 4 new types for SSL connection ACL configuration.
Which are:
L7RULE_TYPE_SSL_CONN_HAS_CERT
L7RULE_TYPE_SSL_CONN_USE_CERT
L7RULE_TYPE_VERIFY_RES
L7RULE_TYPE_DN_FIELD

The first and second types can just accept the compare type "EQUAL_TO"
and value "True" string.
The third can just accept the int value string to check the certificate
verify result, also just support "EQUAL_TO" compare type.
The fourth can accept key, which is "X-Y" format, "X" is the DN supported

commit_message:
L7rule support client certificate cases

This patch add 4 new types for SSL connection ACL configuration.
Which are:
L7RULE_TYPE_SSL_CONN_HAS_CERT
L7RULE_TYPE_VERIFY_RESULT
L7RULE_TYPE_DN_FIELD

The first type can just accept the compare type "EQUAL_TO" and value
"True" string.
The second can just accept the int value string to check the certificate
verify result, also just support "EQUAL_TO" compare type.
The third can accept key, the distinguished name field and a match string,
this one supports all kind compare types.

Story: 2002165
Task: 20025
Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I71b57d0f32d4839a770396645d2b9945d24f2853

commit_message:
Add new ssl header into Listener for client certificate

Add new ssl headers:
'X-SSL-Client-Verify', 'X-SSL-Client-Has-Cert', 'X-SSL-Client-DN',
'X-SSL-Client-CN', 'X-SSL-Issuer', 'X-SSL-Client-SHA1',
'X-SSL-Client-Not-Before', 'X-SSL-Client-Not-After'

Allow users to send to the backend with multiple choices when
tls_terminated is enabled for client certificate.

Story: 2002165
Task: 20020

Change-Id: I112936ee85c9e0dcfb87b962176ba7d623989a30

[{'created': '2019-02-25 11:47:50.000000000', 'message': 'Bump pbr version to 4.0.0

"tox-lower-constrains" tests are failing because of some old
dependencies in lowest "pbr" version (2.0.0). Those dependencies
were removed in [1]. pbr==4.0.0 contains this commit.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/pbr/commit/32c90ba598d7740e52bf21bc5e920fb5df08645a

Change-Id: I7551644ccf65fae19b34eee49151fdafacf29843
Closes-Bug: #1817541
'}]
commit_message:
Bump pbr version to 4.0.0

"tox-lower-constrains" tests are failing because of some old
dependencies in lowest "pbr" version (2.0.0). Those dependencies
were removed in [1]. pbr==4.0.0 contains this commit.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/pbr/commit/32c90ba598d7740e52bf21bc5e920fb5df08645a

Change-Id: I7551644ccf65fae19b34eee49151fdafacf29843
Closes-Bug: #1817541

Add client_ca_tls_container_ref to listener API

This patch add 'client_ca_tls_container_ref' into listener API for front
client authentication.

Task: 20018

commit_message:
Add helper for listing detailed pool information

To support automation of pool creation on a secondary Ceph cluster
in a RBD Mirror setup the actor will require additional information
about pools on the source cluster.

Change-Id: Id88d268d42da6e453879f850ae76575ac3b0adbf

By default, Ceilometer uses polling.yaml as cfg_file [1][2] that defines
the limit default numbers of metrics polled. Users may want to define
their own polled metrics.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/polling/manager.py#L54
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/etc/ceilometer/polling.yaml

(cherry picked from commit d2f4055ce0ab99601d03f5be1b749095c12dedf5)

commit_message:
Add support for Ceilometer custom polling.yaml

By default, Ceilometer uses polling.yaml as cfg_file [1][2] that defines
the limit default numbers of metrics polled. Users may want to define
their own polled metrics.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/polling/manager.py#L54
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/etc/ceilometer/polling.yaml

Change-Id: Iadd627ca3c767453e71c8a0c2044f00f30055f16
(cherry picked from commit d2f4055ce0ab99601d03f5be1b749095c12dedf5)

commit_message:
Introduce default value for `transfer_protocol` parameter

These changes update `simple_update()`.
According to [1], "If transfer_protocol parameter is not provided,
the Update Service shall use HTTP to retrieve the image."

[1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/UpdateService.v1_4_0.json

Change-Id: I7af63eed68ba0d4d038bf94dfdf537b8d1fdc33b

commit_message:
Update source/packages if config changes

Also, this change removes the harden decorators as
the required configuration for harden is _not_ present
in the charm config, rendering it useless.

Change-Id: I20c124d9588b8fd6c0e6611725a848eaf892f6af
Closes-Bug: #1812219

commit_message:
Add transport_url property to AMQP adapter

To support oslo.messaging switch to use of transport_url, provide
a formatted transport_url attribute on the AMQP relation adapter.

Change-Id: I02513dbef01f7fde7db65702d2ad64d2aa72ed0f
Closes-Bug: 1817672
